Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucius.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	As Albucius begins his words, since he has compiled this book for you as the final work of medicine, by completing it I see that it will be an end to it, and through its explanations and clarifications, it seems fitting for me to complete this treatise on surgery for you.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery is entirely destroyed in our region and in our time, so that the science of it suffers great danger and its tools are lost; except for a few small descriptions in the books of the ancients, which have been misinterpreted and led to error and uncertainty until the meanings of them are closed and the strength and art prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is seen by me that I will bring this treatise to life according to the method of explanation and clarification and abbreviation; and for the forms of the instruments of cautery and the other tools of work as well, with the addition of description, and for the preparation of them, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	Moreover, the reason why a good craftsman cannot be found in this time is because medicine is long, and that its practitioner must first be experienced in the science of anatomy which includes knowing the joints and shapes of the members; and having knowledge of bones, nerves and ligaments, and their numbers and origins; and recognizing the arteries pulsating and quiet ones, and the locations for bleeding them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said with his name "art," but in small work, and even more so in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Moreover, we have already said about that in the introduction of this book; because whoever is not knowledgeable about what I have said concerning anatomy, cannot avoid falling into error, so that many men have died in this way as I have seen often, for some are unskilled in this science and take themselves to be without it and its experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced doctor make an abscess called scrophilus on a woman's neck, and cut some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed out, until the woman died among those present.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who thought he could extract a stone from a man's body, which was in its state, and the stone was large, and it came out and cut through the bladder with it, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called for him to extract it, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient he would die as a result.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery and approached a negro slave who had a broken thigh; and with his ignorance he prepared the doctor, extracted the fracture through the wound, using pulley devices and strong rods, but did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he tied it up according to his desires, and bandaged it, and left it unventilated for several days and commanded that we keep it bound; and thus it became an abscess and led to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to it, and prepared to remove the bandage, and achieved calmness and relief from his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But corruption had already set in the member, so that it could not be stopped, and the corruption spread through the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who opened an abscess cancerous and it became ulcerated near some days, until the malignancy of it grew in the lord of it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is because the cancer grows without humor melancholic, so it does not require any special care, but rather that it affects a member which is hostile to everything.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that surgery be divided into two categories: one associated with health, and the other associated with danger in its greatest preparations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already tested this in every place of this book where there is danger and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against it and allow yourself to be misled by the foolish, so that they do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And thus take your weapons with caution and protection of God, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method for salvation and praiseworthy success by the grace of God, and leave the terrible diseases that are difficult to cure, and lay aside your fears for that deception in your faith and in your name will not mislead you: for it remains for your glory, and thus in the world and forever among your sanctifications.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galenus already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat an evil illness, so that bad doctors do not call themselves doctors."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you shall have read this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, and the first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the feet, their forms of instruments and the ironwork of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with abscesses and perforations, boils, sores, extraction of pus-filled sacs and similar conditions, all collected and arranged in the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter deals with restoration and dislocation, and the cure of twists and similar conditions; a chapter arranged in forms of instruments for the feet.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauteries with fire and sharp medicine and the reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to say the qualities of the juveniles of that cautery and its disadvantages, as well as in what situations the cautery should be forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discussion of the quality of the juveniles of cautery and its disadvantages is a long and detailed one, subtle due to knowledge, and hidden secrets; many wise men have spoken about it, and there is disagreement among them, and I will only touch upon a small part of their discussions, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that the use of cautery applies universally to any matter or materials, except for two situations, which are cases without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of dry matter without material, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial in this case, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for a disease characterized by quality and dryness, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is appropriate that diseases that are dry and hard should be treated with something that is wet.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says the opposite, that cautery is beneficial in all dry and hard diseases that occur in human bodies, when you compare the human body and its moisture with the nature of fire, you find that the human body burns.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say on the basis of this discussion, that I have experienced this myself on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not necessary that I come back over what has already been expounded and practiced in the chapter on cautery by previous exercise, and to know the diversity of human cases and the disposition of diseases in their circumstances, as well as the causes of these, the accidents of them, and the time period for these.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However, in other situations, there is no need for fear, especially in the case of cold and moist diseases, because all doctors are already in agreement about these, and there is no disagreement over the use of cautery in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And sons, understand that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it is due to the cautery as burning medicine, because fire is simple, the action of which does not spread beyond the member being cauterized but only causes a slight harm to the adjacent member.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of burning medicine reaches not only the member being cauterized but also the adjacent member and can bring difficult-to-heal disease and prolonged suffering to that member.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	However, fire, due to its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do anything unnecessary; and it is already known through experiment and prolonged study in the art regarding the truth of causes; and for that reason, I am excused from the length of my discussion, and if it were not for the fact that it is not suitable for my book at this point to reveal secret hidden aspects about fire and the quality of the operation on bodies and its expulsion of diseases, I would demonstrate a philosophical argumentative explanation, which could help alleviate your suffering.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Sons, understand that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to perform cautery and pause the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is appropriate in all times, because the disadvantage due to time is submerged in the benefit of what is achieved by cauterization, especially if cauterization is for pain or necessary pains, strong and fistulas, which do not tolerate delay because it is feared that evil will come sooner than a slight harm caused by the passage of time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Do not listen to your suffering, or sons, they do not consider this except the common people and foolish doctors, for that disease which is cured by cauterization is not always successful and they await a bad outcome.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they believe for that, because cauterization is not in a place of medicine which alters complexion and dries up the humidity that is the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But the cauterization is unnecessary in medicine, because of its willfulness to fulfill the virtue and effectiveness of its operation and the greatness of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness may return at some time in the future, depending on the patient's complexion and the location of their illness, as well as its nature, and what has been prepared in their body from excesses, and what has been acquired by them in food and similar causes; otherwise, the illness that receives cauterization is a subtle illness in a few organs with few excesses and humidity, such as cauterization of teeth for pain and similar cases. It is possible that in this case, the pain will not return, but it will be small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But it is common speech that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and it is right-thinking speech, not according to what I understand in this matter, because I believe it is not healing that benefits with medicine or any other reason for cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is contrary to this; the belief that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is not when we administer the methods of healing in some illnesses and those medicines do not work, but rather at the end of the illness, they administer cauterization and it improves the situation.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, from here on, it is clear that cauterization is not the last remedy of medicine, not according to the belief which I understand in the common people and the phrases of foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	They said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They said that the location of cauterization does not harm, because this is not absolutely true, since I have already proven and observed that it does not do so in some bodies, and cauterization with gold is better than with iron as they said; however, when you cauterize with fire made from gold, it is not up to you, because it depends on the quantity you want for the color of gold, and it prepares to be used; if you adjust it above the fire, the gold melts due to the heat of the fire, and in the fire some layers are produced so that the artisan can carve it with the tool of the occasion.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, for this reason, caution must be taken when using iron for cauterization; we should do it gently and as accurately as possible in operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already arranged this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters, and I have arranged those of the head within the feet, so that I lighten the question for those who seek it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On Cauterization of Head Pain Due to Coldness and Humidity.
Le capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization treats the coldness and humidity that cause the secondary symptom of which there are two causes, one is a sign of scrofula and many rheumatic fluxes, called corissa, from the head to the hairline and eyelashes flowing, and many sleeping, and toothache and gout, and generally of any illness caused by coldness, such as paralysis, sclerosis, apoplexy, and similar conditions in these illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: First, the patient must be evacuated with medicines for purging the head for three or four nights, according to the nature of the illness, the age and habits of the person.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then, command him to shave his head with a razor, and then have him sit on a stool and hold his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Approach the patient's thumb and place it against the root of the nose between their nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the location you are referring to is reached, mark it with a probe, and approach the olive-shaped cautery iron.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Approach that location with your thumb in the manner it descends, and gradually tighten your grip until it is securely held, and then rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Lift your hand gently and look at the location. If you see some part of the bone protruding, such as the grains of sand, then raise your hand. If not, return your hand to that tool or another one if it is cooled down until you can see the bone I mentioned to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the location and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Approach the wound edge with your thumb and leave it there until the scar from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Cure the location with a strong four-drug ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	They said that when the wound remains open, it is better to get a splint, because it is more beneficial and helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that the coccyx should be cauterized to the bone and the cautery kept in place until some portion of the spongy bone is charred.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Approach it so that it touches the bone, and heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They said that the cautery should reach the bone in the end, until it penetrates deeply into the bone so much that the bone collapses, and this is the form of the small mortar:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that the vapors from that location will escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	The wound should remain open for a long time and be healed until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauteries in all cases, only in some men out of fear; and leave that one, for it is better for your health, because the head is more exposed to the solution of continuity from the body as we have testified in other members, especially when the patient's head is of a cruel nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The primary type of cautery is safer and better for you; and that method and the work with it are for your health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head's cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a chronic and long-lasting pain in the head occurs in the patient, who has prolonged it with gears, cochias, capirpurges, emplaustres, guatzes, cades, gualinas and similar things, especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that did not help in any of those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong nature; and it is not cruel and there is no great inflammation, then cauterize it with another cautery slightly later.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Approach the corn of his head with a cautery until the coccyx is separated.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the coccyx and expose the bone's portion that we have estimated and cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head in the location called "was," which is the place where air pockets are found.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Leave your hand in this position, and do not expose the bone, because the patient will have a great deal of pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will tell you the location of this cautery, because the cautery used for the corn of the head and the occiput is more subtle than the one used in the other locations on the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the non-ancient migraine cauterization.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is deep pain in the part of the head or it is a dull pain that extends to the ear, treat the head with medications that modify it and administer the other treatment I have mentioned for diseases; and if neither one helps, cauterize it in two ways: either by using acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Hot coals or medicine to burn are the ones you should take a pair of tongs made of iron, and pick up that one and sharpen its ends on both sides with the tips.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the place of pain on the temple with a thin blade that is only deep enough to expose the bone, hidden once it is done.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply strong pressure to the area with a compress, and leave it like that for three hours; then remove the herb and let the wound heal for two or three days, and place a plaster on the area submerged in oil until the pain subsides completely.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of it until it heals completely.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medications that I have written in the second treatise on burning medications.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterization is done in this manner by fire, and the form of the fire for cauterization is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a clawed iron, because its head resembles the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Place your hand over the pain area and hold it there - so that the archer's arm does not shake - and slowly rotate the small iron back and forth.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the amount of tissue burned by the scalpel is large and intense, lift your hand to avoid shaking the artery that is nearby - so as not to cause bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And immerse the wound in salt water and let it soak for three days; then apply ointment to the wound with oil, and take care of it until it heals completely.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, perform cauterization on the end of the cutlery in the manner of cauterization, and be careful to avoid cutting an artery during this modern procedure.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the ancient cauterization of hernia.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an emigranea as was said in the previous treatment and the division of diseases, and the treatment does not help, and sometimes because the disease is not addressed by what was said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then it is necessary that you ignite the cautery knife until it glows, because this means to draw a line on the place of pain, whose length is the maximum size of the finger, or whatever that is; and then pause your hand for a moment and strengthen it, and then make an incision with the arc-shaped blade and penetrate into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary that you watch over the jawbone, which is swollen, you should make it move again so the ligament is not adhered and the nerves that are affected by it, and to prevent convulsions.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of a cut artery's bleeding, for in the cutting of it there is fear, especially to those who do not know what they are doing and are not trained or experienced; leave the operation at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will come to remember the regulation of bleeding from an accident in the artery according to its method, in that book of this treatise.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if this disease is not helped by this cautery and the body of the patient can tolerate it, cauterize it in a more suitable place on the head as we have said, and cure the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if it is necessary to administer the cautery that was said in the chapter on constriction of the artery with a cautery having two knives, this is a better and more appropriate cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is cured with medicinal causes and the other cure mentioned in the division, but the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, which is called puncta, and this is its shape:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then place the puncta near the ignition and direct it around the entire ear as if a wheel is rolled, or in the circuit of each sample if the pain is in each.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Draw the puncta cautery of the ear's edge slowly, little by little, since you know the place with certainty.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the puncta cautery is applied all over the ear, then cure each spot until it heals.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of turtur.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtur which is cured with cauterization is not anything but the spices that come through a flegma, as was said in the division of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterizing the spice that enters by drying or by convulsion of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that spice of turtur with herbs and capupurgis and guarguarisms, and your cure does not help, then it is necessary that you cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first one should be the edge of the ear, the second a small one on the temple, and the third the connection of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cautery opposite to the diseased part, for softening does not appear except in the healthy part that appears healed.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery along the edge of the ear tip and slightly above the hair on the crown of the head, in the temple whose length should be equal to the length of a finger, and then pause your hand with the cautery until the quantity of the substance of the wound has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery, it is the type of the knife, and the shape of which is like a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more delicate than that, and it is necessary to have a knife with minimal roughness in that place.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And cure the area where the process has not yet healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Chapter 8.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it with what was said and your medicine does not help and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: first of all on all the hair on his head; secondly in the middle of the head as we have said; thirdly in the neck; and fourthly in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cautery is done as was said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach, and this is the last one; and take care to cure it with what processes you have.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterizing forgetfulness caused by fever.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Cover the patient with warm blankets and administer large pills to purify him.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the head of the patient and apply a plaster as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Place the patient on several watch for a while, as this is the method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to the procedure you have already stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if this treatment proves beneficial, then do not proceed with further cauteries. However, if it does not, make three cauterizations in the lower division of the head, starting from the most sovereign part of the head to the most inferior part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Wait between each cauterization for the thickness of the finger, and care for the cautery with what is appropriate.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if the patient is tolerable of it, make another cauterization in the best location; and if you wish for more addition, then cauterize it over both cornices (corners).
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Care for it until it is healed; and make the cauterizations olive-shaped as previously described.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterizing for relief and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Cover the head with warm blankets and administer pills as previously described; then shave the patient's head, and cauterize it in the best location on the head, on all the corners of the head, on the lower division, and three cauteries on the spondyles of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for the treatment of softening the body, and the patient is tolerable with the treatment and the illness is severe, then cauterize it with four cauteries on the spondyles of the back, and later cauterize it until the cordage is completely burned off, and raise the patient's leg.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Care for it until it is healed, and make the cauteries olive-shaped.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterizing epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Do not cauterize the epileptic person, but rather that epilepsy caused by fever.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, you must purify the brain of the patient at the beginning with yarrow and with other treatments as previously described in the section when the patient is great and tolerates the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate medications, administer gargle and masticating remedies that purify, before that with the passage of several days, with purification of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient and cauterize it with one cautery in the best location on the head as previously described, and another cauterization on the back of the head, and cauterize each corner of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerable, make cauterizations as previously described with a paralyzing and softening effect on the spinal column and spine.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And make the cauteries olive-shaped as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, pause with subtle cauterization as described in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterizing melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and large fever, make cauterizations with the cauteries as previously described with paralyzing effects.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluity declining into melancholy and the body of the patient is moist, administer to him what purifies the brain as previously described in the section.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the head of the patient, and apply a pigeon-shaped poultice made from the proper ingredients on top of the circle, and leave it in the best location on the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	The patient should be placed in a sitting position, and held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply the linen; it is more appropriate for an old sheep to be bound.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat that part over the fire, warming it gradually by measure; this is what they call suffering when placed there.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place that in the appropriate place at the head of the bed, and let it enter until it is immersed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this with the patient every week once, and follow the appropriate regimen for him until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize it by making small points as much as possible, without having a hand with such a prepared cautery: this is a special cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then place that swollen area in bandages or in linen cloth.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of water flowing in the vein.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have been declared the beginning of water in the vein by the signs I told you in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink that which purifies his head, and keep him from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	Let him bathe in warm water for three days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then order him to shave his head, and cauterize that in the appropriate place on the head; and cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of water in two veins, or with one cautery if it is the beginning of water in a single vein.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut all the veins and arteries that are covered by the skin with a cautery; and place the cauteries in that length in the region of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Keep yourself from bleeding when you are cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from it, stop it with some medicine that is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with wisdom in the extraction of arteries and the abscessing of that, as well as taking care to prevent bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes it is cauterized in the cerebellum between two bones with two cauteries properly produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears in the veins are old, and through the veins and arteries that are manifest in the head's location outside, it is shown that this is excessive fluid, then cauterize it with a cautery that was mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water flowing in the veins, and with a cautery in the appropriate place on the head and two cauteries in the cerebellum between the temples, and two cauteries in the cerebellum between two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to add, then cauterize it along the entire length of the vein on the forehead above the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nose smell.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that with what I have said in the division and your medicine does not improve, then prepare yourself and give the patient three nights of colocynth, and shave his head, and cauterize it with a moderate cautery and an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize it with a camomile cautery and two cauteries on the two eyebrows, just below the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	Keep yourself from cutting that artery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	The form of camomile cautery is as follows.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the moistening cautery for the eyelids of the veins.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the vein is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery and with this moon-shaped cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if it is you who cauterize, do so on both eyebrows with a small one and two in all directions, and elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the third part of the eyelid that is being cauterized.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of the eyelid of the vein when the hair turns into the divisions within and pierces the vein.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the vein turns into the divisions within and pierces it, there are two methods of cauterizing them: one is by fire or is by medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cauterization is by fire, order the patient to shave his hair in this way as those who wash them do, until they are elongated and curled; and if it penetrates, you should press the veins of him with a bandage to prevent harm until the hair grows back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When they are grown back and curled, place the patient's head in your lap, and put your hand over the eyelid of his veins with a sign, with the sign being like a sea urchin, and the beginning of the sign near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place warm oil or egg white on the ulcer.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And heat the cautery of which this is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize the area with a small, rounded tool, gradually making dots over it until the surface of the wart is burnt, just like a leaf of myrtle, completely apparent.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the treatment's success is that you see the wart's eyelid contract and its hairs raised due to the puncture on the wart.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore raise your hand and keep it there for three days, and apply a dressing over the area until the scar is raised.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Apply ointment to it until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the hair grows back for some reason and the eyelid becomes soft, then do another cauterization of it just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize it until it returns to its original position and is healed so that the hairs do not pierce the wart.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If the cautery with medicine burns the hair, command the patient to pluck the hairs until they are elongated and healed, and apply a piece of paper or cloth in the shape of myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take known and living worms for the cure. The Latin abbreviation "i.e." means "that is" or "in other words". It's used to clarify a term or phrase that may be unclear or confusing. In this context, it would not be needed as the sentence is already clear in English. And what is this, mix those causes well, and do it with haste so that it is not spoiled; then expand the mixture on a paper in the shape of myrtle leaf, and place it over one or both warts; then place warm oil or egg white on the ulcer, and have the head of the patient be near you.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Place the medicine on the wound and press it gently without moving it until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, as a bite is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore, when you perceive that the herb has bitten, remove the medicine and apply it again with your fingers; therefore, when the bite ceases, remove the medicine and wash the wound with water; then consider if the eyelid has risen like it should be washed by fire or incision, as this is good; and if not, place the medicine back on the area where it was not pressed, but do not let it spoil until your operation is complete and the ulcer is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the area with a bandage until the verruca is removed, and treat it with castor oil or another remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to ensure that your treatment guards with careful vigilance that the medicine does not fall off the ulcer; if the eyelid becomes soft within a few days and some cause of the hairs pierce the wart, then you should repeat your medicine over the area where the eyelid has become soft, just as you did initially, and turn it over until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that warts in men are diverse according to their size and smallness, so accordingly you should perform your treatment.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the path of rectitude for the one who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization of fistula that is in the lacrimal duct of the eyelid.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat fistula as we have said in the division of diseases and do not confer your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to hold his head in your presence, and have another servant near him in such a way that he is neither harmed nor agitated by his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place warm oil or egg white on the ulcer of it.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And heat the cautery, which is in the shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The shape should be concave, like that of a reed or a pen with a turning point, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it penetrates into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	If you want it to come out in this way.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for the operation.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press the fistula if it is open, and draw out pus and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not open, then open it and remove the scabs from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Place your hand over the cautery which should be well ignited, and keep the other a little away from the nose, so that your hand or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery on the vein of the nose and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	If at the beginning of your cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; and if not, you should repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; leave it like that for three days, and place a bandage over the area with a dry dressing inside until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If it has passed ten days and is not healed, place a strong corrosive medicine over it until the bone is exposed and scraped as necessary in its section.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another method of cauterizing a fistula which some have said: insert into the location of the fistula and close it, then place a thin substance in that fissure, the shape of which is like that: And it was the quantity of one ounce of lead melted; and keep your hand with good grip, and let the lead not harm the patient because the melted lead does not reach the vein of that one; and cover the vein of the patient with a linen or water, for lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	If the fistula is healed by what has been said about cauterization and cure, that is good; and if not, it is necessary to administer trauch from the nose and reduce the fistula to the center of the nose according to its location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the anus fissure.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Fissures often occur in the labia, and particularly in the labia of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if your treatment of these fissures does not help, you should burn them with a small cautery knife in this shape that we teach you:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	The concavity of it should be according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place that instrument carefully in those fissures until the cautery reaches the opening of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms under the uvula or on the palate or between the teeth and you apply a bandage, it breaks, becomes purulent, and a fistula is formed, and if your treatment does not help, you should burn cautery according to the quantity received in the fistula, and place the burning iron in the fistula opening, keep your hand until the hot iron reaches the abscess opening, and at the end do it again once or twice; and cure it with what we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	If the pus is separated and healed, that is good; and if not, it is necessary to expose the location and drill the rotten bone according to its location.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are damaged, and you treat them with medicines but it does not improve, place the patient's head in your lap, and hold the cautery tool of the shape that will come to this purpose, so that you can quickly press the instrument handle on the tooth and insert the burning cautery into the cavity, keep your hand a little away from the patient until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and move the cautery several times according to your desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, then stop it, because a damaged tooth is closed, a softened gum is strengthened and excess moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to inflammation, or there is an abscess or worm, or treatment with medicine does not help, you should perform cauterization in two ways: cauterize with a cowhide bandage, or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing with a cowhide bandage is that you take a cowhide bandage and heat it in an iron pot, then take a piece of the heated bandage and wrap it around the end of the probe, immerse it in boiling water, and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Approach that area several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the boil mentioned above, place it on the painful tooth, and place the hot iron on top of that until the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization with fire should be done carefully, and there must be some caution when it comes to the ear or iron, for there may be some large growth and the heat of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And approach the hot iron in the desired shape, place it on the tooth and keep your hand there until the cauterization is cooled; do this several times until the pain subsides or on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary to press the patient's mouth with good cloth so that they hold it for an hour and spit, and this is the shape of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize as desired, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the form of the cannula:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization for hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are caused by cold and humors infiltrate them but do not respond to medicines and you wish to promote digestion slightly, then heat the iron in the shape as shown below, having two handles attached so that the smoke escapes through one handle, and place the hot iron on the apostema once, or if necessary, repeat until it reaches the edge of the apostema.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII. (This seems to be another chapter number in the document)
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On cauterization for ulcers of the throat and constriction of the veins.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture comes over the windpipe, especially when it is accompanied by cold, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and you should cauterize the root of the trachea in the compressed area.

De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On cauterization for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by cold moisture, the patient does not have fever or shortness of breath, and it is an old illness, then cauterize that area with two cauterizations on the furcula in the compressed areas on the left and right sides; and another cauterization in the middle part of the foot between two breasts; and let the cauterizations be made as shown before.
