De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization for scrotal itch, which is the head of the testicle.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the testicle is displaced due to lubricating moisture and does not return to its place in the usual time, then you must reduce its displacement before it returns, and place your hand on one side or the other of the patient, and lift the cartilage that is inside the scrotum towards the scrotal walls with the fingers of your left hand if the junction is displaced internally.

e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and be careful to make it as thin as the thickness of the tent, and this is its shape:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And after some time, it will be adjusted according to this count and because the cauteries are eight. (This seems to be a reference to the number of cauterizations needed for a certain treatment)

If the displacement is above and it is done thus, then cauterize over the muscle with a flat or pointed cautery, because the junction is confirmed and the moisture is subsided, and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Title (capitol). xxvi.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On cauterizing the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When phlegm and mucus enter the stomach and it becomes enlarged due to this disorder and multiplies, and if you continue with treatment and do not help it, then it is necessary that the patient lies on his back, extends his arms and legs, and cauterizes it with three cauteries: one cautery under the feet about a finger's width from the heel, and two cauteries under the costal arch of the feet until the triangular figure of the cautery is formed; and elongate between those not in line to avoid blistering.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cauterization is twice the size of the thickness of the skin.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be in this form without addition. If you want, cauterize with a large cautery at the middle of the stomach in this manner; and this should be a circular cautery according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	Cauterize the stomach at the place that is frightened by this cautery: and you should place a point on the stomach according to the amount you want with a trial, and cauterize there with the cautery at the points; and care for it with the treatment that follows until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Title (capitol). xxvii.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On cauterizing the hernia in the groin.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When the groin is painful due to heat, moisture or excessive wind that causes it to go beyond its normal condition by egression, and the patient is treated as previously stated without improvement, then it is necessary that the patient lies on his back, and three cauteries should be placed according to this form and quantity on the groin below the hip bones, i.e., in a man's lower abdomen.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	Let the space between each cautery be according to the size of a finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the body straight ahead.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press down on the cauterized area.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of what is applied matches the thickness of the skin and it is not too tight, and if the patient stands on his feet; and if he is not standing, make him lie down, who has already extended his legs, and raise his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	This is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And you can cauterize these cauteries with a surgical knife, when you are skilled and careful in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo the cauterization, and ensure that the skin is carefully punctured in order to pierce the entire body and reach the hernias, because the skin here is delicate; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Title (capitol). xxviii.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On lancing an abscess in the groin with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an abscess or boil occurs in the groin and you want to know if it is in the flesh of the groin or in its membrane, then if it is in the flesh of the groin, the patient will feel heavy and painful without increased pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	If it is in the membrane of the groin, then the pain is greatly increased and often doctors become tired in its treatment.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, it is necessary for the patient to lie on his back; and show the location of the abscess with your finger; and heat the cautery that resembles thread, whose shape was previously described on another page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	Cauterize the abscess with that and the cautery until the skin is completely burned through to the pus, until it bursts and drains pus.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And care for it with treatment for other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	It is not necessary to use this type of cautery indefinitely, but rather the one studied in the art of medicine for a longer period and in which many diseases have been known; however, it should be noted that sometimes this operation can be dangerous, but still, it should be done if needed.
Capitol .xxix.	Title (capitol). xxix.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On cauterizing scrofula.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauteries for the sores of arthritis were applied to scrofula in this manner by a skilled practitioner, and it is this one that you should take from the long, dry razors found, and it should be about the size of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Then immerse it in oil and heat it over the fire, then cauterize at the location that is between the continuation of the neck and the collar; and two small cauteries placed under guidance, one slightly declining near the part of the beard, and two cauteries on that which is declining between the fifth rib and the spine, slightly declining towards the backside; and another on the mid-foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauterizes at the lower backside; and one on the location between the shoulders, and two cauterizes on each foot, under the one that is between the shoulder blades.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is necessary that you compress your hand on the cautery, not in its hollow, but rather on the open wound.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And it was said by some ancients that some men use a cautery similar to iron and hot like it, and put it in that place which is between the ribs until we reach that abscess and the pus is drained out, as we have said in the abscess of the foot.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with a cautery there is no fear, because the person may die immediately at that fistula to which there is no healing.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When treating spleen disease as previously described and your treatment is ineffective, you cauterize it in three ways, all of which are suitable, one of which is to make three or four stitches according to the length of the spleen following the shape of the cauteries in the foot, the shapes of which have been previously shown.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And the distance between each cauterization should be about the thickness of a finger or slightly more, and the method of cauterization should be the same as that previously described in the foot cautery.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not compress your hand on the cautery; rather, the patient should be placed on his back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	Another method of cauterization is to ignite the cautery with two prongs, as we have mentioned in the dislocation of muscles chapter, and lift the skin which is near the spleen so that the patient's left side is revealed without obstruction.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	Your lifting should be such that you lift the skin according to the length of the body so that the cauteries can be made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And insert the two prongs, heat them up, in the area where they pierce the skin of the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And withdraw the cautery; thus four cauteries will be made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you want to cauterize with a cautery having three prongs.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And return your treatment of the cautery that has been soaking for several days, because it is more effective than the other causes previously mentioned in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cauterization of dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Do not cauterize in dropsy, but only in a bladder specifically.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When treating dropsy with the methods of treatment previously described and your treatment is ineffective, you must then cauterize with four cauteries around the navel, one over the stomach, another over the foot, another over the spleen, two between the vertebrae of the back, one at the heel, and another over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cauterization should be appropriate for the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And let the cautery be released after it has been soaking for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from treatment near the cauterization with what is necessary for two intentions, and it should be hastened to him with the help of healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery used to treat the abdomen should be like a nail, according to its previous form, and it is that one which is used to treat the feet, following their previous shape.
Capitol .xxxii.	Section .32
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the cauterization of feet and the genitals.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are affected by edema and filled with stagnant water, it is necessary to cauterize them on the back of the foot near the ankle, elevate your hand with the cautery without twisting it; raise your hand, but do not let go of the cautery, for the stagnant water drains.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be made in this manner: Place two cauteries on both sides, and in each side make a cautery with the tip of the cutting edge.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cautery should be as long as the side of the affected area: The first one goes below and the other above the same location on the opposite side; and on each side, two cauteries are placed.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	Leave the wound open without treatment for a long time so that some water can drain from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And take care of those causes which were mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Section .33
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cauterization of abdominal organs.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When an abdominal organ becomes weakened and moistened to the point of becoming soft, this affects its digestive and retentive functions, which are located in the stomach and intestines, and it can be treated with various methods of treatment without consequences, and sometimes the patient may require cauterization to show the effect, so cauterize that area with a large cautery over the stomach as described in the procedure for cauterizing the stomach, with the circular cautery and four small cauterizations around the umbilicus, with a fine needle-like cautery; and with cauterization on the alkatin (small intestine) over large areas, or with two cauterizations.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if there are excessive moisture and the patient is able to tolerate it, cauterize that area on the pudendum (genital region) and intestines, and strongly place two cauterizations over the stomach and close to the inguinal regions, for this is a perfect cure for which you will not go wrong.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Section .34
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When ancient hemorrhoids occur naturally or one becomes weakened due to cold humors or corrupted moisture, they can be treated as mentioned in the previous section and their cure is not to be doubted; cauterize that area with three cauterizations on the base of the anus, a triangle shape, and with a caution over the umbilicus.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	If you suspect that the stomach of the patient is weakened and their food is not spoiled, and sometimes the opening of the stomach becomes an ulcer, then cauterize that area over the stomach with a large cautery as described previously; place one cauterization on the liver, and another cauterization on the gallbladder with a fine needle-like cautery; leave the cauterizations open for some time until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Section .35
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Of cautery for athlete's foot, near the abscess of theirs.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you remove athlete's foot, then heat the cautery which is like a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Approach that opening with the heated cautery, and place its tip into the vein from which blood flows out.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Do it once or twice, for if there are many abscesses, cauterize each of them according to what you have counted, and apply ointment to those with open wounds until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	If you cauterize with a large cautery on something, it is more helpful afterwards.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are naturally made in the divisions of it.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that has been recommended in its place, and the patient is afraid of it, cure it with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when a fistula appears naturally in someone and is old, corrupted by pus and humidity, it is more suitable that this be treated with fine thread, and bring the amount of the depth of it together with the previously mentioned thread.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Approach with the heated cautery which is like a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And bring that heated cautery to this fistula, and according to the amount in which it intersects with the thread.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Repeat over that area until the rotten tissue is burned off quickly once or twice or three times, according to your necessity.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	Be careful not to burn nerves or veins; or if the fistula is in the body of the bladder or in the body of the intestine, be careful at those places; and do not do it unless the fistula is in a fleshy area and you consider that it is not penetrating.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area until it heals.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	If the area is sealed, and the materials are removed from it, and it remains like that for a long time, then you should know that it is healed completely.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	If the materials are not removed, then you should know that it is penetrating or in the bone and is corrupting, or be careful of these causes which will come to mind in its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On the cauterization of sores.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When pain occurs in sores due to cold or thick swelling, and the patient's body is weakened by it, then it is necessary to cauterize them on each sore with a cautery over each sore using a heated iron that recalls its memory.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	Hold the cautery with a small gap between them, so that three cauterizations will be made in a line, and thus they will be more helpful afterwards.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When weakness and softening of the bladder occur due to cold and humidity such that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize it in the lower part below the bladder, where the pubic hair begins, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	Let the length of each cautery be according to the number of holes in the bladder; and cauterize it in the lowest part of the back, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	Let the cautery iron be as previously prepared.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Treatise on Cauterization of the Meatus (Urethra)
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When the meatus (urethra) becomes inflamed and humidified, it is prohibited to engage in intercourse, and menstruation is corrupted due to this, and its provocation is delayed, and pain occurs during their discharge, then it is necessary that the location be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said in the cauterization of the bladder; and a cautery should also be applied above the location or two cauteries, and they should be cauterizing iron.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL (40)
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Treatise on Cauterization of the Dislocation of the Ankle
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When humidity spreads and penetrates the ankle joint, causing its dislocation, a sign of this is that the limb is longer on one side when compared to the other.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is felt in the bulging area.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, it is necessary to cauterize the patient on the ankle joint with a circular cautery, as you will have a sign by probing in the circle around the joint, and thus causing the joint to fall into the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery for this procedure should be shaped like the one used in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three cauteries using an olive oil-shaped large cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the size of the dislocation throughout the entire limb, and then care for it until it heals.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLI (41)
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Treatise on Cauterization of Sciatic Vein
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle joint due to inflammation and humidity, the patient is treated with the remedies mentioned earlier and no other, which is an ancient method; then it is necessary that you release the patient from thick humors with pills made of purgative herbs or artificial pills similar to them, and then cauterize it.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of cauterization in this case is according to two methods: either cauterizing with medicines that burn, or cauterizing with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	If you are following the first method learned (cauterization with three triangular-shaped cauteries), then do so over the ankle joint, making sure to achieve good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be the size of the finger (thickness of the cautery, whether olive oil-shaped or large).\]   E aprop fay al malaute la man que es dita de la partida de l’ancha, e le manteneys en aquel loc per molt temprat.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	When the cautery is placed over the middle of the ankle joint, there should be four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	This is the method of cauterization in fracture when pain is adhered to the ankle and not extended into the joint.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended into the joint, then you cauterize it with two cauteries on the joint at the place where the pain occurs; and with one cautery on the shin, four fingers distanced from the skin.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if it is a lancet cauterization, and the depth of the cautery should be according to the size of the blister.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient's pain is extended to the location near the ankles, then you cauterize it here where the pain occurs, with a cautery at three or four points, or more if necessary.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient's pain is under the buttock, then you cauterize it here with a lancet cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Be aware in every cauterization that you do not burn nerves or major arteries, and thus harm the patient or cause contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen one and another of those who cauterized on the shin and overburned in the cauterization, and the leg became inflamed up to the foot, and the burn penetrated and rotted the entire foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And approach very carefully with caution from the abdomen, and thus death will be avoided.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two places, cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	The wise say in the ankle cauterization of this type, make a circle of iron the size of a palm, and place it so that its holes are according to the thickness of a date or almond stone.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle is another third; and the space between them should be equal to the width of a finger; and these circles should be open in two parts; and the length of those keys one or two fingers, and make the margins of iron on the circles decoratively arranged; and this is the shape of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Approach the fire and let it burn until it becomes red-hot and sparks, and then place it on the division of the ankle, with the patient lying down on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus, cauterize it with three concentric circles at a time.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat. Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	"Al-Zahrawi says: My son, we have used this type of cauterization sparingly due to the fear of its consequences, and because few people have observed it."
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But among the best cauteries for it, there is one that is suitable for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels. E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And place your hand on the division of the ankle, with the patient lying down on their side and press the affected area firmly; and take boiling water in a container, and pour it between two circles, and the quality of that should be gradually hotter, and hold it for about an hour, and the patient must endure the burning and squeezing of it—for this is similar to fire—until the pain stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And raise your hand with the tool and wash the affected ankle area with warm water.

Leave it alone for three days and place ointment on it until the blackness of the burn subsides, and leave it like that for some days, and it will produce scabs, which is a good sign.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And care for it with salves until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended into the joint or thigh, make it stationary in such a way that it contains water as in the case of the ankle immobilization.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	This is the method of hot water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medications.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray. E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Let it rest on the bottom of the wave again in another boiling water, and pour the alkali and live charcoal over it with warm water, which will rise up to one finger, and when you press them with your hand for good compression, let the hole that is in the water on the lower side of the boiling water open in the lower wave.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then adjust all that water, and pour another living substance and other alkaline reagent over it, because at that point it will be of great strength and sharp acidity, which is administered in many medical operations and in cauterization of other members, since the operation acts like fire.

The method of an ancient Greek physician, and the cure for joint pain and sciatica pain, is very great indeed, and it is said that no other treatment is needed, since it heals in one go as recommended, because the remedy is strong and effective in a bath and application as advised.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat. Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil. E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	Repeat this process and do not stop until the sensation of the bite reaches the joint and the pain subsides.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	This method of cauterization is called the "cauterization of cows."

Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Treatise on Cauterization for Ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre. entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Heat it until it begins to sparkle.

E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	The cauterization of children should be subtle according to their size and age.

E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	Let him be given rest and nourishment in food and drink, with strong remedies, for if this treatment of healing is followed completely, he will recover.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	I will describe the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the stomach, and to begin with, let it not be neglected: cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its size, so that it is completely closed as the third part of it; and then care for it with what has been said, and not leave it untreated.

e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor. Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of twisting.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When an injury or blow causes pain in any part of the body and this pain persists for a long time without improving with medication, it is necessary to cauterize it using a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	The cautery should be applied to every part of the body according to its size, nature, and location of twisting or pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	If the injury is healed by the first cauterization, that's good; if not, continue to apply the cautery on it; because it is customary for those pains to be points of one member near another, so you must achieve that with cauterization before the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47. (This line numbers the chapter but does not translate the text itself.)
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leprosies of some kinds are treated with cauterization to great advantage, and mostly if the type of leprosy is caused by rottenness or melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	Therefore, when you wish to cauterize it (the leprosy), consider whether the leprosy is common and curable as mentioned in the division and not incurable, or present, and fear that corruption will affect the entire body of the person and their limbs; in such a case, cauterize it on the head with two cauterizations: one in the middle of the head, the second farther away from it, bring the forehead to the end of the hair; and both on top of two horns (corners of the skull); and one behind, on the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	Finally, hold your hand on the cautery a short distance before it touches the bone to produce a slight indentation and move away the scabs so that the expulsion of large vapors is alleviated; and cauterize over the skin as previously described.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread on the patient and is manifest, it is necessary that you cauterize it with the cauterizations described in the head; and cauterize over the tip of the nose, and two cauterizations over the eyes, and two cauterizations over the spines of the neck, and six cauterizations over the spine of the back, one large one near the coccyx, and one on the coccyx, and two over the ankles, one on each ankle, and two over the joints and one on each joint of the fingers, and two over the elbows, and two over the muscles, and hold the tendons of his feet; and cauterize it over all the joints of the hands and feet, and over the soles of his feet, and over the phalanges of the toes.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful not to burn the nerves that are on the sole when cauterizing.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	It is sometimes cauterized with one cautery over the bone of the penis and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	You should know that the closer you place the cauterizations, the more beneficial it is and more effective; and you should know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, as happens with sores, because the body of the person is already anesthetized.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It is necessary that the cauterizations be large or few according to the members and joints as previously described in the tools (instrumentation).
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Apply the cauterization with flour of roasted barley, honey and other remedies until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cauterization of numbness.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is numb or asleep and is treated with medications, oils, and plasters but does not heal, you should then cauterize that numb member according to the size of the member or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	Let your cautery penetrate slightly into the skin (epidermis).
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Treat that member with ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	Sometimes numbness in the hands and feet, in the spine of the back, and in the eyes (optic nerves) is cauterized, and it is alleviated.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not presume this, but rather one who knows the anatomy of members and the exit of nerves throughout the entire body moving them.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49 (This line numbers the chapter but does not translate the text itself.)
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of tumors that are swollen.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When a tumor is old and does not improve with any of the ointments of medicine, you should then cauterize it over that area with a pointed cautery a short distance according to the size of the swelling until the whiteness and color disappear and the color changes.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	Treat that member with flour of roasted barley and lentils, olive oil, leaves of arnica, and the blood of pigeons or hens; each should have an equal part, and all are mixed; and let a cloth be placed over it until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of crabs (scabies).
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a crust is forming and you wish to remove it, cauterize that area with a circular cautery as it is rolled (or rotated).
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	The wise say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle; however, I do not see this, as I fear it may become ulcerated, and I have seen this happen several times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more appropriate to cauterize [the affected area] in the circle around it as we have said, or with the word 'cautery'.
Capitol .li.	If there is a stone or something foreign body in the bladder, and you cannot remove it by means of the hand or the instrument which you use, then you should cut open the bladder along its length.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of the cauterization of ulcers.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	If an ulcer is delayed in maturation, due to superfluity or the patient's state being old and weak with little blood, or due to the season, and you want to hasten the maturation of the ulcer; then cauterize around it with small cauterizing points; and apply a soft cloth over that which will cause it to mature faster.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	However, if you want to perform perforation with the cautery, then heat the cautery, and immerse it in the proper place of the ulcer until it penetrates through it.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is in the place that is more distant, to relieve the body of the arm; and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Of the wounds of the head and face.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of the cauterization of corrosive agents.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosive agents are corruption that travels through the limbs, which corrodes in the same way as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see a corrosive agent in a location that suffers cauterization by fire, heat the cautery with iron nails small and large, as is appropriate in the location where the corrosive agent is present.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	Approximate the cauterization of that entire area until you eradicate all the corrosion and no cause remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Approximate the bandaging of that for three days, and place it on the cauterized areas, soaking them with oil mixed together until all scars are completely eradicated and all corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Approximate the care of that with warm flesh-generating cure.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if the flesh heals well within three days without corruption, that is good; but if not, repeat the cauterization over what has been corrupted in those areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	Corrosive is treated with some medications occasionally, for it is a substitute for cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But in truth, cauterizing with fire is somewhat beneficial with pus.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the treatment of it with sharp medicine in the division, so take that when you need it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cauterization of nails and similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Often found in the regions below the feet, illness called nail, which is large and closed, that pierces the foot; and cauterization in those places is performed according to two methods, namely cauterization with fire and cauterization with boiling water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is that you heat the cauterizer shaped like a pen of a bird's tail, made of iron according to the size required to treat the entire nail, and it should be thin-edged.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Approximate the bandage of that which is heated over the nail, and turn your hand with the cauterizer around the circumference of the nail until the cauterizer reaches the depth of the nail.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Bandage that for three days until it starts to weep pus.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Approximate the plaster of that with a mixture of wild mallow leaves steeped in salt, and bandage the plaster over it for one night, for this will be eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Approximate the care of that area with warm flesh-generating cure until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and often happens on the surface of the body, particularly in the hands and feet, then you must administer cauterization with water, namely take a cup made of horn or iron or bird's tail pen, place it over the nail; and get a little amount of boiling water into the cup, hold your hand, and turn the cup around the circumference of the nail with pressure on the edge of the cup in the root of the nail, and let the boiling water pass through the root of the hole; and make the patient wait for about an hour for the pain caused by the boiling water to subside, then remove it, for the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do this to those and that in turn until you have treated all of them in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	Approximate the care of those pus that come from the roots of the nails which generate flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When a tremor arises due to cold in the nerve or fever caused by cold, or for other similar reasons, it is necessary that you cauterize that with four cauterizations or more on the spondylus of the back, between each spondylus with one cauterization; and on the feet, and on the stomach, cauterize olive oil.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	The tremor of that subsides and hastens the healing of the cold disease.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 40.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of abscesses occurring in the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When abscesses and pus-filled holes occur in the body which are formed from corrupted gross materials, at the beginning when they appear, it should be cauterized over the entire abscess with a subtle cautery made of mirt or fine razor, the tip of which is extended with fire; or with an egestological long lancet; or with a slow-burning cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.
