If it is summer and the places are fleshy, then you must pack powder made of alum water and oil or vinegar and oil, and leave it for three days as I have said, and then you must drain the abscess and cleanse it, and administer the treatment to it that is appropriate until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	This is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses universally, but according to the distinction I have already said about every abscess in a particular manner, this is the method of treating it by chapters specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLI.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the sectioning of abscesses that occur in the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck, small abscesses occur that are of a special type containing tunics which are made from it; and the types are numerous.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they have blisters, and those that contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those that contain moisture similar to flour and resemble them; and those that are hard and stony.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the sectioning and removal of them, there is no fear, as excising them does not counteract archery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation in the sectioning of them is that you should expose them with an instrument shaped like this, which is called entromes, until you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	If it contains moisture, then you should cut it with sectioning along the length and sectioning along the surface according to this shape:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	Start the sectioning from line B to line G, so that when the moisture is evacuated, you excise it, and do not leave any cause of it at all, because too many watched return if there is any cause left.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment if it is present, or if not, in water and salt; fill it with that mixture and leave it inside for another day, because with that acid it will rot everything remaining of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Approach that area with an Egyptian poultice secondly and thirdly if necessary, until you trust that there is no other cause of that skin layer; then treat the wound with the poultice until it heals.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains fatty nodes, then you incise it as follows:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	Make an incision in the shape of a cross, and cut between the edges of the incision and remove it entirely from all sides, exert your effort in extracting the sac containing it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if you encounter resistance in your incision, do what I told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Treat an opened abscess and its healing as you were told earlier; incising an opened abscess is easy because it contains little blood and moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Sometimes these abscesses are in the head in some men who have no humidity at all; this is caused because when I incised an abscess on an old woman's head, it turned out to be hard, rough, white, and could not be crushed, and if anyone were to strike it, it would cause pain.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other types of abscesses that occur in the head, this is not relevant to the topic at hand, such as abscesses that occur on the scalps of children and require the removal of the scabs; but the incision of these should always be a superficial incision.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	Pause the puncture of those in the lower part of their body, as this will alleviate the pain in the lower parts of their body.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is necessary for their healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On incision of scrofulas that occur on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Most often these abscesses occur in the neck and on the shoulders and in the joints; but sometimes they also occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	These abscesses that occur in the neck, and those that are caused by swelling, and all scrofula of this kind is divided into its own layer, just as in the nodes and abscesses on the head, as we have mentioned before.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	The types of these scrofulas are either swellings, some of which are hard, and those that contain moisture, and the malignant ones that do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that which you see well-positioned in the incision, whose color is similar to that of parchment and extends throughout its entirety without being attached to the nerve of the neck, nor veins, nor arteries, and is not tumorous, it must be incised shallowly along the surface of one side of the body from line G to line B, and scrape it off in its entirety, then cut two edges of the parchment with scissors or a scalpel if needed, as mentioned in the abscesses on the head, and carefully remove it piece by piece.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It is more careful not to be incised the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	Let the spatula not be too sharp, that it does not press on you in incision or disturb the patient, and that incises what is not necessary to incise; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and prohibit yourself from your operation, then pause at the stitching of the plaster or other powders which stop bleeding, and let it dry, and leave it alone until its acuity subsides and the abscess becomes soft and turns into pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is drained.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have finished it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And ask the patient if there are any other small scrofulas, therefore incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is near the great vein of the scrofula, then it must be ensured that it is not incised the scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Advance carefully so as to fold it strongly and let it fall on itself without harming it.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old linen which you have already smeared with Egyptian ointment and take care of it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the entire scrofula, then it must be ensured that you approximate the two edges of the wound and stitch it as soon as possible without leaving any superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity due to the large size of the scrofula, it must be understood to incise the root of it, remove it and administer stitching and what has been said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that scrofula which contains moisture, it must be perforated with a superficial perforation at the location of its maturation, and pause the perforation of what is causing the deepest pus in the body, as has been said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And apply perforation, warm with heat and similar to those, so that it destroys what has been removed from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see the wound already cleaned, then take care of it with generative meat ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter xliii.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the pit of the abscess in the guolary.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients made this incision on the pit of the abscess, and no one in our land has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the writing of the sermon of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men having scrotum, it must be avoided the extraction of the pit, for it is not helpful because all the veins and larger vessels of the patient are nearby.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses cauterized in the mouth or scrotum or both ears, when the disease is not in the neck, it must be ensured to perform incision of the pit to avoid the danger that is caused by suffocation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to perform it, we must incise the pit of three or four circles of the scrotum, or a smaller one in the breadth in that which is between two circles according to quantity, and let the incision be in the cavity, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for incision because it lacks flesh and its blood vessels are easily accessible.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is poor, it must be ensured that you extend the parchment of the scrotum with a scalpel, and cut the parchment to the canal, but avoid blood vessels if any reason for them occurs.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And it must be ensured that you incise the cavity according to what has been recommended; and it means over the incision of the canal for the flaccid member which is from that place with the area where it has been torn apart and the abscess of the throat.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound be kept open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, since the hour is extended in which perforation is feared, add two edges of the parchment of the wound, and stitch only with the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And apply medications that make the flesh heal until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the essence of the sermon which we have recommended is to open the scrotum of the patient who has one or more abscesses, and if the patient comes to death, and the anus of him is cut, then someone goes to incise the epiglottis so that the patient breathes through the wound for some respiration, and he is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason we command to keep the wound open until the evil of the disease is consumed; and it is the evil for three days; and therefore we command to stitch the wound, and take care of it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	What I see has been witnessed by me is that a servant took a knife and inserted it into the patient's chest cavity and cut off a piece of the lung, and I was called for treatment. I then listened to the wound as one listens to the dying, exposed the wound, and stopped the bleeding which was coming out from the small hole in the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Furthermore, I verified that it had not pierced a vein or artery, and the wound was bleeding. I cured it until the wound healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	The servant did not speak unless he was ordered to, and return in several days for further treatment of her condition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now, I will tell you that there is no fear in the section of the epiploon.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	In this section, we discuss an abscess that occurs in the chest wall outside, which is called a hernia of the chest.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	The hernia of the chest abscess is a large abscess as indicated by the color of the body, and it is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	It can be either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the case of a natural hernia, there is no remedy for it.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental hernia can be of two types, one of which resembles fatty nodes, and the other type resembles an abscess caused by thickening of an artery, in which case there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	It is necessary to make a presumption about it only in the case of a small one.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You should examine it and investigate it as described above, if it resembles fatty nodes but is not suspended in any veins, then you should cut it out the same way as you would with lipomas, and remove it with what contains it of skin and bursa; otherwise, you should thoroughly examine its entire existence, and apply a remedy to the area until it heals.
Capitol .xlv.	Title. Forty-fifth.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On cutting of the types of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of knots of various kinds and I have already said all their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary that I distinguish between a knot and an abscess as there may be doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that an abscess is heat and fever and violent pain that subsides the ebullition of excess fluid; it is a completed rotting that now ceases the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a knot is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains that cystic lump which is in the bag of the bladder.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And according to the color of the body, and it begins like a boil, and is made in the same way as cheese, whether large or small, and there are two types, one fatty and containing moisture, and the colors of the moisture are swollen, as I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the treatment of a knot, extract it and investigate it at its beginning for the stone that is called intromes, according to its shape which will appear in the chapter that is close to this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	The method of investigation of abscesses and all knots is that you take this stone, introduce it into the moist part that you find in the abscess, and you roll your fingers over it little by little until you know that the stone has penetrated the skin.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Approach the wound with your hand according to the size of the abscess, and extract the contents while considering what is issuing from its trace.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	If the moisture flowing out is forgotten, regardless of its color, then you should cut it with a surface incision as mentioned in other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	If there is no moisture coming out from the abscess's trace, then you should know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	Dry over it with a section shaped like this cross:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	Thus as you have been taught, and suspend it with a thread, and cut off the skin from all parts with ease, and preserve the skin or sac, if possible, over it and extract the pus with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	However, if it is torn during the operation, it will not be possible to extract the healthy part, and therefore you should examine whether there is any cause, and then extract it in pieces before anything remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	But if something remains, either a little or a lot, return the node according to what is more appropriate.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that a small part remains, then fill the wound with some sharp and corrosive powders and strengthen it, and place a cauterizing plaster over the abscess, and cure it with another healing method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	If the node is large, then you should cut both lips of it and treat it with whatever causes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	However, if the pulsating vein is opposite or not pulsating, you should cut it and fill the area with boiling vinegar that is triturated and let it rest for two to three days until the plaster dries and the bleeding of the blood stops; then return to incise what was torn from the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of the instruments necessary for cutting and piercing.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of these, the abscesses are of three types, one is large, another is middling, and the other is small.

E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	These are the forms of the lancets, and they are called albeds, and one of them is called burd.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	They are of three types, one large, middling, and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of the large lancet is as follows:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of the middling lancet is as follows:

Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It seems to be discussing medical conditions. Here's the translation for this sentence in English: "It is necessary that these are due to abscesses, eruptions, fistulas, and buboes because some of them are from bones and other causes."
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	"Then, the boils, abscesses, and carbuncles are to be treated with large needles similar to great pins, which are sewn through the skin. They can be made using lime, iron, or silver. The best are those made with lime."
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	"And the black plum juice is used to treat these, as experienced physicians agree that for such boils, the fistula should be opened in the concavity of which the reflection takes place, and this reflection should be reflected with its light onto those reflections."
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	"And of three types, where some are long, others medium-sized, and others short, according to the size of the fistula and its narrowness."
Forma del experient gran de plom:	"The experienced physician forms:"
Forma del experient migier de plom:	"Form of the average physician using lead:"
Forma del experient petit de plom:	"Form of the small physician using lead:"
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	"The shapes of the nails are of several types, where some are simple, with only a curve, and there are three types: large, few, and medium-sized."
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	"And from these come the uncurved ones, and they are of three types."
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	"And of those uncurved ones, some have two curves, and there are three types."
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	"And from these come those with three curves, and they are also of three types."
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	"And all these are necessary in their place."

Forma de unci simple migier:	"Form of the medium-sized simple nail:"
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	"Form of the few simple nail:"

E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	"And these are the forms of scalpels with which knots and abscesses are cut, and they are of three types: large, medium-sized, and small."
Forma de scapel gran:	"Form of the large scalpel:"
Forma del scapel migier:	"Form of the medium-sized scalpel:"
Forma de scapel pauc:	"Form of the small scalpel:"
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	"The edges of those from which the incision is made are sharp, and the others are not sharp, and they are not stopped in this way, but rather they are made with caution during the excision of the knot to avoid injury to a vein or nerve, and for these the patient will heal and gain a small amount of peace due to the cauterization which is necessary after the incision of the abscess."
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	"And these are the forms of cauterizing agents (alum), and they come in three types: large, medium-sized, and small, as you can see."
La forma de magda gran:	"The form of large magda:"
Forma de magda migier:	"Form of the medium-sized magda:"
Forma de magda pauc:	"Form of the small magda:"
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	"They are made of lime and resemble glass with which alcohol is made."
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	"And the pointed edge is coated with a hidden spatula, and when you want to move it inward or outward, as you see."
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	"The forms of spatulas (small instruments), which are hidden between the said ones during the incision of abscesses and not perceived by the patient, come in three types: large, medium-sized, and small."
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	"And these are the forms of those:"
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	"The forms of forceps (instruments) with which the flow of blood is cut off, and they come in three types: large, medium-sized, and small. The forms:"
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of lemon rind, round in shape with some length, and they are subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	It is necessary that these leeches of various sizes be prepared: large, medium, and small, so that with them you may quickly remove blood flow in necessity, and at first treatment there is no medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to draw blood in every part of the body, but only in fleshy places, such as in the armpits of the shoulders and the groin, in the armpits of the chest, and in the breasts, abdomen, and genitals, and similar parts with fleshy areas.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	Some veins are made with such small instruments resembling fish-scoops shaped like this; through which blood is drawn when it is done by venipuncture, or incision of a vein or an artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	Some veins are made round in shape like this:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On treating the male breasts, which resemble those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some veins are inflamed in the male breasts, and must be treated like scabies as they begin to appear, and inflame the breasts, resembling those of women, and we must apply remedies, leave them alone.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for the one who suffers from this, it is necessary to incise them with a semi-lunar section as shown here, from line B to line G, and remove all the pus, apply a layer of carminative medicine, bring together the edges of the wound with stitches, and treat it until it heals.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast declines towards the hips and is softened like in women, then it should be cut in two pieces, with two semi-lunar sections as shown here, each contained within the other, so that the end of one is inside the other according to this form, from line B to line G. Remove the coagulum, which is between the edges of the wound, clean it, and administer the treatment and powders mentioned above until it heals.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If you do not complete the incision that is necessary to incise, due to the restlessness of the patient and bleeding, then you must clean the wound with a cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it until the ointment corrodes away what remains of the coagulum, and treat it until it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the perforation of abscesses that come from the armpits.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	The abscesses that come from the armpits are of the species of scrofula, hard ones, which contain a pus sac.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of them contain moisture; and those that contain moisture must be incised with a semi-lunar section as shown here: from line G to line B. When all the pus in the abscess is evacuated, you should completely cover it with a piece of cloth and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And keep the cloth covering and treat it with an appropriate ointment until it heals.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess of the species of lymph nodes or scrofula is, you should cut it as mentioned in the section on scrofula.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	If the wound is extended and exudes pus, you should apply cautery as mentioned earlier.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On incision of abscesses that occur due to an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the coagulum that is above it is consolidated, abscesses occur and there are signs to distinguish whether inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or a vein: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it is long and located in the neck of the body; and if you press on the abscess with your fingers, you feel stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And one that is due to a vein is round in the manifestation of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And incising the abscess is an error, especially in the armpits, groin, neck, and many other parts of the body; and it is dangerous, so its treatment with iron must be avoided, and one that is near the edge, or on the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But on one that is due to inflammation of the opening of the artery, cut the coagulum section lengthwise; and separate the section with stitches and the artery, and open the tunics until it is exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And place that needle over the other incision and make it penetrate through, and tighten the ligature with a firm double knot at two places - which causes you to be an apprentice in the extraction of two ligatures that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then punch the place where there are two ligaments with a spatula until blood comes out completely and the abscess is resolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then administer treatment to produce pus until the ligaments fall apart, and then cure it with appropriate care until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	If it is an abscess caused by vein section, you must have your hand on the abscess with a ligature and administer treatment, then insert the needle at the place where you have your hand, and make it penetrate; and use double thread to pull it out from the other side, and tie the abscess with a good ligature as I have told you in the grape vine ligature of two parts and both ends of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear pulling out the thread, insert the needle through the entire abscess first, and tighten your four fingers at the incision of the needle.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in a part of it until what is in it comes out, then you incise the excess of the ligature, and leave what is left connected.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And place a poultice on the inflamed part that you have immersed in wine and oil, and administer treatment with warm and wet care until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter of the abscess that occurs by twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Similarly, as abscess occurs in the ligature and vein, so it occurs in nerves when it occurs due to excessive labor or injury, and for similar reasons.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	The worst thing is in the locations of the joints or ankles, or in any location where the joints are injured.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe abscess, and its color is similar to that of the body, and it is in the larger areas of the body, and when it is narrowed with great force, the patient feels like they are stunned.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	It is not an abscess in the front of the body, and therefore it should not be ligated, and it is harmful all over, and does not spread to the sides neither in front nor behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those who are in the joints should not be sewn with iron, because a strong blow will cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But those who are in the head or forehead should be ligated with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, you can use forceps and excise it cautiously.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, you should suspend it with an uncini and excise it, then close the wound and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 11.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On abscess section that occurs due to the cheek that occurs in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	In many men observed in the abdomens of those and in other parts of the bodies of those who are called worms due to their resemblance to fungi, whose heads are thin and caps are large; and the labia of these are turned inside out, and it is small and it is greatly enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one, and in his abdomen were two things that resembled fungi, and there was no difference between them white, small worms.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the labia of these were turned inward and split, and moisture ran from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, you should incise them and turn one inward by eighteen inches. and the other by six inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation of incising them is that you consider whether the patient is humid and the color of the abscess is white, moist, thin pus; then you make an incision with a spatula flat, and be careful to cauterize in fire because many observed should have the section of it expelled without much blood; and if it bleeds, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is weak and afraid, avoid incising with iron; but take a new leaden thread and tie it as described before; leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then tighten the lead thread in the constriction of the thread; therefore, you must not tighten the large amount of lead in the worm too much until it is excised and falls out by itself without labor.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the worm is of large size, you should make an incision with some cause for fear and anxiety, especially if it is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	Possibly you can incise the size of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And care for it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	Be careful to avoid incising a worm that is of dark color, with little sensation, with regular shape, because it is cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will return to the memory of cancer regarding this.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 12.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Treatment of the umbilicus in an emergency.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The navel is treated for various reasons: either due to a fissure of the navel which exposes the intestine or hernia as in other ruptures; or due to bleeding that flows from veins or arteries as previously mentioned, or due to constricted ventositas within it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is due to a fissure of the navel and exposure of the intestine, then the color of the abscess is similar to that of the body; it is less painful, and different treatments may be applied.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	If it is due to the exit of the intestine, place that area with something that has been recounted earlier, with a greater degree of diversity, and as you press it with your fingers, it becomes hidden; then return it; and strong heat is applied to that area, and the wound should be cleansed with much effort.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to moisture, it is less painful and not hidden when pressed with the hand, neither constricted nor swollen.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	If it is due to bleeding, darken the abscess by applying these signs:
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is due to rotten flesh, the abscess is severe, large and hard, and should be packed according to a certain amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to wind, the touch of that area is less painful.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	The operation in that area should be considered if the umbilicus is due to bleeding from an artery, vein, or wind; you must be cautious of treating it, for there is fear and danger as taught in the chapter where abscesses caused by arteries and veins were discussed.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the umbilicus is due to intestine or hernia, you should command the patient to empty their bowels and remain extended; then place your hand around the entire umbilicus, and command them to stay facing upwards between your hands; then circle the area of the umbilicus with a thin spatula; extend the size of the abscess towards the navel's edges with great force; and tie it in the circuit of the umbilicus with strong thread or cord, and use a proper technique for tying.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Tie the middle of the extended abscess to the ligament and introduce the pointed instrument into that area as indicated and try to push the intestine back into its place; if you cannot find or hold it with the ligament, then you must extract the hernia and forcefully push the intestine back into the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	If you have found the hernia, take it with one hand; and incise any excess tissue from that area.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	If it is against your artery or vein, then encircle that area and return to your operation; take two needles and tie them with strong thread and insert the needles into the circuit you have created around the abscess in a cross pattern, making the needles penetrate; and tighten the abscess in four quarters over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If you wish, remove the needles and allow the extended flesh to fall back on its own; or incise that area which is thin and may be easily closed, and care for it with something that is suitable for wounds until it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	If the umbilicus is due to rotten flesh in that area or moisture, you should follow the steps as previously mentioned and extract the pus or moisture from that area, which you will then hold in place, and care for it with something suitable and that consolidates the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter thirty-three.
De curacio de cranc.	Treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have said in the division, about the kind of crab and in what manner is the cure for it with medicines, and that it is a scourer in its healing because it is ferrous so that it is not ulcerated; we have said crab originates in the spleen and the caution in its healing.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	The ancients said that sometimes crab is in a place where it can be eradicated, such as the head, which is like the mammary glands or their corresponding parts in other members, and especially when it begins small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it becomes old and large, it is not necessary to treat it, because I cannot heal from it nor have I seen anyone else, nor has it been reported to me.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	The operation in it is when it is allocated as we have said, that you precede and leave the patient alone for some days and purge them of black bile several times, and apply hot poultice to it if it is a clear and obvious abscess.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient with the preparation in which the operation is located, and warn them of the painkillers that are necessary for it; and bend the entire body from all sides with a good traction until there remains no cause for the pain.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood flow from it and do not open it lightly, squeeze the areas, and clean the thick blood with your hand or an instrument that you can handle among those available to you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it contradicts your intention to bleed thick blood from a vein or artery, then cauterize that until the flow of blood stops, and treat it with other treatments until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Treatment for edema.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, about the kinds of edema from water and the signs of each kind, and the cure for it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	The one that is cured by iron is only the species of altitis alone, and it is not appropriate to apply iron to the species of tympanites nor to the species of hypoxeresis because it is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	When you have already treated this species of edema tympanitis with medicines and it does not improve, consider that if the patient has already achieved debilitation, or is suffering from another disease such as edema in the lungs or stomach, like those, then be careful not to treat it with iron because there is a fear about it.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient with an excess of strength and not suffering from another disease besides edema alone, and neither old nor young, then the method of operation on it is that you raise the patient between your hands, and apply pressure to their abdomen with your hand, direct the water out through the lower part of the penis, and take a mouthful of dry peppermint leaves according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	two pointed sharp parts, of an acute shape like peppermint leaves; but it should be in some shortness, little by little, so that during the operation with it you do not pass into the intestine and damage it.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Consider whether the generation of edema is from the intestines, because in that case you must be careful to move away from the navel by about three fingers' width at the lower parts, on the right side of it above the penis.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of edema is due to liver disease, then your incision should be on the left side of the navel by about three fingers'width.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation is from the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	Your incision must not be over the ribs where you want the patient to lie, so that fluids do not accumulate at that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then perforate the entire intestine with an instrument, enter that incision and lift your hand with the peppermint leaves between the intestine and the bladder, and you will remove it; if there is the thickness of a nail or more.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then perforate the bladder to where the peppermint leaves reach the place of water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Extract that and introduce an instrument of this shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and is similar to a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver, brass or copper, on the lower part of which there is a small hole, and on the sides there are three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and it is sharp at the end like a pen nib, as shown here:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And on the upper part of it there is a band (armilla), so that when the instrument reaches the water, you immediately place the band on the instrument to evacuate the water in the best possible amount, because if you evacuate more than what is necessary at that time, the patient may die suddenly due to resolution of their animal spirit, or they may experience cynopsia which is near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	Evacuate from there according to the quantity of its power and according to what the condition of the patient signifies regarding the quality of the pulse and goodness of it.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then approach the instrument, and let go of the water that is retained because it is being held by the clamp that is over the cuff, and recommend to you that you perform it according to that method. (Note: "le instrument" refers to a medical tool or device used in the procedure mentioned previously.)
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	If the patient tolerates it, approach the instrument on another day, and extract a small amount of water, do so over several days with caution, and be careful not to let any water remain except a little. (Note: "aquo" refers to the medical procedure performed earlier.)
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	If you fear the patient, and let out a large amount of water, then treat it with burial in sandy ground, move the wound over hot bath, and expose it to the sun for a long time; and treat it with drying medications until it is healed. (Note: "aquo" refers to the medical procedure performed earlier.)
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	Cauterize the stomach, and the liver and spleen near the water extraction site, as I have previously reported in that treatment. (Note: "aquo" refers to the medical procedure performed earlier.)

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of children whose genital areas are not perforated (or undescended). (Note: It is unclear what "locs de la urina" refers to specifically, but it seems to indicate a problem related to the urinary system or genitals.)

In some cases, one of the children is born from the mother's womb and the head of the genital region is not perforated (or the cord is tight or it is not in its proper position). (Note: "la sua mayre" refers to the child's mother; "mixtio" seems to refer to the baby's genitals, but I am unsure of the exact meaning.)
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to perform a perforation as soon as possible with a thin probe in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then, tie a thin lead clamp around the cord and leave it for three days or four (days). (Note: It is not clear what "trauc" refers to specifically, but it may be a reference to the umbilical cord.)

And if you do not release the lead (clamp), it is possible that the urine which flows over the area will not be able to pass through this closure. (Note: It is not clear what "aquest claure" refers to specifically, but it may be a reference to the baby's genitals or the umbilical cord.)

If the cord is not in its proper position, release it, which occurs because in some cases, when the baby is born with an umbilical cord that is not properly positioned, the head of the penis cannot urinate at the birth canal, and you must lift the penis to the birth canal with your hand until the penis is raised over the birth canal. This is not a problem related to procreation because the sperm cannot reach the mother as it should, and it is a serious illness. (Note: It is not clear what "les partidas" refers to specifically, but it may be a reference to the vagina or the birth canal.)
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	The procedure for the operation in this case is to position the patient on his back, and then extend the head of the penis from him with your left hand using forceful extraction, and cut the end of the head of the penis at the location of the foreskin with a sharp instrument such as a needle or blade. This should be done in such a way that the meatus (urethral opening) aligns with the end of the penis and the umbilical cord falls into the meatus as it should. (Note: "lu" refers to the baby's penis, "la tua ma sinistra" means your left hand, and "pluma" means feather or pen.)
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And be careful in your operation of bleeding (or hemorrhage), because it often happens in this procedure; pause and wait for the bleeding to stop, and treat the wound until it is healed. (Note: The exact nature of the operation being referred to is not clear.)
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 16. (Note: This appears to be a heading or chapter title for the next section of the text.)
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	On cleaning the albuginea (fibrous tissue) that occurs in the foreskin of the penis and scabs, blackening and adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis. (Note: It is not clear what "albater" means specifically, but it seems to refer to a medical procedure related to the penis.)
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Often this condition occurs in the penis and is a painful protrusion of flesh. (Note: It is not clear exactly what "es eminencia de carn laga" means, but it seems to refer to a painful or problematic protrusion of tissue on the penis.)
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one is malignant and the other is not malignant. (Note: It is not clear what specific conditions are being referred to as "malignant" or "not malignant.")
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant, it is necessary that you suspend it using a thin wire and remove it until it is completely cleaned; then pause over the affected area and apply Egyptian ointment on it; and after that, treat it with Egyptian ointment daily until it is healed. (Note: "enguent" likely refers to an ointment or salve.)
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if an abscess is malicious and dark in color, you must administer cautery close to its incision and lance it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	If an abscess is at the base of the foreskin of an uncircumcised penis and it splits into two parts, one inside and the other outside, you must first open the abscess that is within, until it consolidates; then you should take care of the outside because if you heal the split while the foreskin is still not secure, it may burst.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And it often happens in the genitals and on the darkened and corrupted foreskin, so you must cure everything that has already been damaged or is about to decay or has decayed; and apply liniment on it, which is made with ground mustard seeds and egg yolks and vinegar.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	Then you should heal that with the other treatment until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if blood flow occurs, administer lunar cautery as follows:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because cautery helps in two ways at the same time, one for blood flow and another for the wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is destroyed and everything is corrupted at that time, you must insert a lead tube into the foreskin for the patient to urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the attachment of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this attachment does not occur except in one who has an intact foreskin and circumcision is not required; and when attachment occurs due to a wound or abscess) it is necessary to break the adhesion with a blunt spatula until the liniment dissolves and the head of the penis is released from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate that very strongly, you must break the adhesion between the head of the penis and the foreskin in some way, because the foreskin, when thin, can easily be perforated by its own fragility.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	Then you separate the foreskin from the head of the penis with a thin instrument that is moistened in water to prevent them from sticking again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And it should be healed with warm styptic until it is solidified.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter LVII.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the purification of children and on the treatment of those who suffer from circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a cure for continence like other diseases: but because it is our operation and theirs by our will, and the removal of that part is specifically in children, it is necessary to assign the best procedure and the easiest method possible without harming their health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore they did not write about circumcision in any of their books, because it was not used in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it by experience, the cause being that I have found that most craftsmen and barbers use circumcision and purification with a new knife and torches; and they use liniment and incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already prohibited all these methods and I do not find a better purification with scissors, liniment, or needle in circumcision like with the nail because many times the skin is torn more than before because the foreskin has two layers and one layer remains behind, and it is easily punctured again and certain pain occurs.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And the purification that is performed by alphecats and is called digital, which is used by shoemakers, is not secure for the incision of the tip of the male member because it easily enters the wound.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in circumcision with the nail, a sharp knife can cut and spoil your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the skin of a child is naturally short and many times it does not need purification in that manner because there is no need for it, and I have seen it myself.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But the purification that is performed with scissors and liniment with a needle has been found by me to be bad, because scissors are of proportional incision, so the sharpness above is equal to the sharpness below; and therefore when you press your hand in proportionately two sharp points, and cut it accordingly according to a comparison in one time; and compression of the liniment with a figure containing the skin of the penis from all sides, with which there can be no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the method of the first operation is that you keep the child lying down more if he is one of those who are small, that you do not make him stand up except when you put the needle in his penis and let it go the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And make sure that he is happy in every way possible with whatever understanding he has of this procedure.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.
