E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this suture, I sewed up a wound that had occurred in a man's stomach, which was pierced by a knife, and the hernia was larger than one palm, and it had protruded from both sides of the intestine around two palms from the middle part of the member; and after that I reduced it when the intestine had been out of the wound for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	The wound was healed in the space of fifteen days or more, and it was cured and healed; and it lived for many years and was maintained in its condition, and it was convalesced in its dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	The other doctors had judged that it would not be healed; but by miracle, for I did not cure it with the mouth, for it was in a place where no medicine was found nor remedy, but rather it was pressed on the wound twice daily and rinsed frequently with honey water until it healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will tell you two types of stitching according to the words [of Scripture].
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with the sewing of the linen, and enter the needle from the outside to the inside [of the wound].
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And thus, when the needle penetrates into the linen and enters there as instructed and in the length of the entire body, and leaves the head end where you have inserted the needle; and let the needle penetrate into the other end from the inside out through the other end of the thread.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And thus, when you have made it penetrate there [the thread], then make it penetrate another time in the same end of the needle from the inside out to the outside; and leave the head that is there, and let the needle penetrate into the other end from the inside out.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And let it penetrate with your puncture through the head at the end of the needle that is within it [the wound], and let all of it penetrate there.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin from this side and sew the other end of the needle to the head end that is on the other side, and draw out the needle from the linen that penetrated there, and return it to the linen and sew the head end that is on the other side with this end of the needle; and draw out the thread from the linen.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do it one time and another, and continue doing it until you sew all that is outside according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this method of sewing is that you sew with the skin suturing that sews the hair, so that you sew the head once from the side of the end of the linen, and let go of the other side until it is finished.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second type of stitching that I shall tell you, which is called "Gaul" and this one is of great authority and is highly recommended, is that you sew it like a semilunar suture as certain physicians do, namely that they bring together all the parts to their corresponding sides naturally; and they apply the end of one side and the end of the needle to the other end of it, and this is done as I have advised.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is necessary that the needle be placed at your side of the outside edge, and make it penetrate into the inside edge in the same place, and let go of two head ends; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside in two head ends.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And turn each one of them, and make each one penetrate from the inside out to the outside in two head ends that are opposite to the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of sewing is better than common light stitching, and it is the sowing that was mentioned before.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Galenus
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And others say that the abdominal suture is corrected with two needles, so that you enter each one of them a thread, and begin with the intromission of the needle that corresponds to you, and let it penetrate into the other side according to the suturing of those who sew the liver.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	When disruption occurs in the correct location of the stomach, the suture is more difficult in that place than in other locations of the stomach.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The judgment of medicine for one disease is a judgment for other diseases as well.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	The cause is that when you reach the recent pustule before the air alters it, and reduce the intestine and cauterize it well, then pause over the carnivorous powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the pustule, then pause over that alum paste until it hardens and falls off, and heal it in the same way as the treatment of other pustules until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you are not present with the medicine, then pause over it as soon as possible, because it begins to rot, olden, and change every two days, as you have taught me, until it is healed, for you do not need another medicine in these simple cases.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the pustule may communicate injury to major members, then it is necessary that you immerse linen in dipped oil of quality, or rose oil, and apply it to the areas between the joints and leave it there.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or rot in the intestines, as it often happens, then you must sterilize that with black teppe stiptic vinegar, and especially if the pustule has been reached in the intestine and has made penetration into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that the one of a large intestine is easier to heal than the one in delicate intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	It is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gegunu" does not receive healing from a pustule that occurs there; this is due to the great number of veins present there and the large size of it, as well as the subtlety of its body and its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what comes from the pustule is the linen, and you succeed in obtaining it recently, reduce it according to your teaching with which you reduce intestines.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed and already become green or black, then you must tighten it with a thread over the affected area of it, because in linen there are veins and arteries that flow blood.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then insert another ligament there and pause the two ends of the thread hanging from the area around the pustule opening, so that it is relieved of its attraction, you must cut off the linen and release the blood flow from the pustule.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remember the pustules when they occur in the intestines.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a disruption occurs in the intestine and is small, it is possible that it can be restored in some men, because I saw one who was pustulated in his stomach with the thrust of a lance and the pustule was on the right side of the stomach, and the pustule was old and made a fistula, and it was healed by treatment and wind.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore I continued the healing of it even though it was not yet cured, but I continued to refine it until the fire healed and the area was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw the area already consolidated, then examined the patient who had suffered an accident of evil in his stomach; and no one should approach this unfortunate case due to that misfortune and change their diet and drink, but instead stay in bed and exercise according to their words.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced ones said that when a pustule occurs in the intestine and is small, it is necessary to tie it according to this method: take large bread crumbs; then adjust the two lips of the pustule and place one of them on its mouth over the two lips of the pustule; thus, when you take hold of it and tighten its mouth, cut off the head of it, because it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then pause another bread crumb next to the first one, and do not continue making them one after the other according to the size of the entire pustule.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then reduce it and heal the pustule; and leave the attached heads in the intestine until the intestine is healed; and do not harm the patient with any injury.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible to tie the intestine with a very fine thread made from the intestine of an animal attached to it, because it is finer; and take the end of these threads of intestines, and make them quite bare, and tie the end of it with another thread, wrapped, and insert that thread into needles and sew it with that the intestine, and reduce the disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	This method of stitching with needles is not only based on trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	If the wound is large and widespread, especially if it is in one of the subtle hernias, then not only is surgery required but also not complete healing will occur.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Treatise on ulcers and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any wound or boil that becomes old and chronic, and does not heal and bleeds continuously without being cured, is universally referred to as a fistula and we call it an ulcer.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	A fistula is a hard, nodular, white lesion that is not painful and has a concave shape like the shape of an ulcer caused by a bird's peck; for this reason it is called a cicatricial ulcer.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	In a man with an ulcer that bleeds, the pus is often purged in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	Sometimes this pus becomes thickened, scanty, and slimy.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	I have already stated the classification, so when I say ulcers, any ulcer that does not heal or is covered with necrotic tissue, it is not one of these causes: a) lack of pus in the body; b) corruption of the region and is a plague; c) hard skin prevents natural healing; d) the lesion is indolent; e) the ulcer contains pus that is poor quality or transmits harmful substances; f) the medicine is not suitable for treating it; g) corruption occurs in the region, and it is a pestilence; h) due to the region's properties, as in Saragossa, where digestion of diseases is difficult, and healing of ulcers is delayed by nature; i) there is one bone, many bones or cartilage in the lesion.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all these causes, their symptoms and the treatment with medications in the classification.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And so, you should know that the healing of fistulas is done through surgical treatment with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	You should know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body, as they reach large veins and arteries, nerves, spleen, intestines, bladder, one of the ribs, one of the vertebrae of the back, or one of the joints composed like the hand and foot; and those are the ones that provide proximity to the main member and similar areas.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	Therefore, the fistula that occurs in this manner is one of the difficult-to-heal diseases and does not receive treatment, with the occupation being labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	If one of the fistulas has such depth that it does not reach the places mentioned and you hope for its healing and believe in its treatment, but wish to find out more about it, then take a probe or iron, and if the fistula is straight, use it to explore it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	If the fistula is twisted, then investigate it with lead wire, because lead has the property of lightness in its body and will alleviate and correct the twist.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	If the fistula has horrible movements (spasms), it is not possible for you to probe it.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore close the orifices with its own orifices, because the moisture that you use to close one will pass through the others and run out of them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then proceed with extreme care, for it is important to know if you have bone or nerve here, and whether the fistula is long or short, or if it is one that has horrible movements and is all around the entirety of your strength, your questioning, the examination of the patient, and the discovery of pain, you should use compression on the area with your hand and similar to the symptoms and causes of an abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all these causes with certainty, then go to the treatment according to confidence: it is that you consider if it is an apparent fistula near salt, long away from joints, or of nerves, arteries, veins, or one of the places which I told you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry out the fistula as it was said in its description, and remove what is in that filtration and corrupted flesh, and what is born from the orifices of the skin, or nails and similar, and cure it within where it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is deep, and as it should be, you must incise it up to where it is possible for you, and clean out all its corrupted flesh; and administer warm poultices wrapped in medicines, and insert these into the cavity of the fistula, which you have grasped with an iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this for some time until the acute medicine burns all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula due to its corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And place a healthy dressing on it, which generates healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, you must cauterize it as you have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you must certify that, then you investigate it and dry it out as you have recommended, but do not prevent any cause of a vein or nerve or main member as I have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is corruption and blackness in it, you cut into it until the corruption is completely contained; and heal it with something that causes it to regenerate until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and continues to discharge pus like before, you should know that you have not completely eradicated the corruption; then you dig further and proceed with great care and cleanliness, and restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if it is healed, that is good; and if not, you should know that the corruption is deep in the body, which has not been reached, and therefore there is no hope of healing it.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small and it is possible to remove it with forceps, then you remove it with fine forceps that are suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if the bones are moving, you must perform the extraction of all of them with great care, and do not leave any cause of resistance with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any cause of the humors opposes you, and in its incision there is neither fear nor error, then incise the membranes or flesh where they are, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at this time, then wait for the wound to heal, and leave it surrounded by flesh and membranes, and guard the wound so that it is not consolidated and the section which you have incised in your operation is constricted.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Therefore, if you fear, wait for the wound to become dry after being immersed in olive oil or in a strong Egyptian ointment, or in one of the green dressings, because when those membranes dry out, the separation of the bones is facilitated and the attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the femur or thigh or similar, and what is rotten is only on its surface, then you remove that with resin only to the point of removing the blackness and corruption, and restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if what is rotten is a large part and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and cut into it until the point where the corruption is found, and heal it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that which befits a man in his chest, namely, to place it as an example and aid on your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	Find a young man about the age of thirty who has pain in his chest, and from the inside parts, there is a bad smell near the matter inside the body up to where the matter reaches the chest, and it is matter of an abscess with a large abscess, and not caused externally.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time was extended due to the error of the physicians until the abscess has been drained, and I ran for materials, and its healing was delayed until the wound became fistulated, and it was filled with pus and the moistures of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	For then the treatment of many physicians lasted around two years, and they were not wise but skilled, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	I saw the wound of him and the materials flowing from those ulcers due to large holes; and his body was completely solidified, and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted the probe into one of those ulcers and it reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I approached and examined all the ulcers, and found that they were spreading in every direction from the wound.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut myself open and incised over one of the ulcers into which I discovered a portion of bone, and found that it was rotten, and already it was putrefied and corrupted; and a part of the wound had already penetrated to the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I cut out what I had uncovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I cut out that which was not bone but corruption which I had excised and removed, and I had already drained it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And I placed the restoration of the wound with consolidating medicine for a long time, but it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I continued to cut and uncover the bone again over the initial discovery, and found continuing corruption with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I cut out that which appeared from that corruption, and then I was perforated to make the healing and restoration, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I continued to cut and uncover further and did not cease to incise the bone little by little particularly, and made the healing and restoration of it, but it was not restored until I incised around a palm of it, and that extracted with the marrow, and then restored it with medicines, and it healed and consolidated lightly.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	The operation and section of it were not necessary, but only for the looseness of it and the scarcity of its tolerance and fear of death, because to him it happened at all times due to excessive evacuation of bad syncopes.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus it heals completely, and nothing remains in place of the bone; and its position is arranged well within his body and restores its virtue; and it converts in its dispositions, and does not harm him in any way nor cause any damage in any circumstance.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone protrudes in a place of the body that has been injured, then it is necessary that you cut it according to this method: and it is that you grab it firmly at its extremity, and order someone to stretch it out; and bind it tightly with linen thicker than the first binding; and hold it over the skin that was left behind, and extend its edge so that you pull the skin apart from the sides, and you uncover the skin over the place where you want to cut so that the cut does not harm the skin.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And stop a board or table beside the bone decently, because when you do this it is not prohibited to cut the corrupted flesh with the knife.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the cut be over the corrupted place little by little, because if it is in the cavity of the rotten bone and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, then perhaps the cut of the other side should be made.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is rotten and not protruding, it has a continuous division with the other, and the corruption is in one or some parts of it; then you uncover the entire skin; and stop a board beside it, and then cut the first part where the corruption continues until the cutting of the other part is continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	The cut should be according to the location of the corruption as I have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in a joint, incise that corrupted joint and cut the bone where it continues with the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not reasonable but deceitful.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the hand or foot, it is difficult; but it is necessary that you investigate the corruption according to your method and cut it open, and clean it according to each disposal which is possible for you, and with each deceit rectify yourself, so that it does not harm a vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know what the saws and knives are for cutting these bones according to their position, and the preparation of them, and the thickness of them, and their subtlety or coarseness and their smallness or large size; therefore it is necessary that you prepare all kinds of operations suitable instruments for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation means for you the kind of tool that is required; when with you it is great study and long experience in the methods of this art, and witness to the methods of diseases, then you already have what is appropriate for the tools to all diseases.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	You are forming at the end of this chapter the number of instruments that you will use as simple ones with which you will proceed in your prohibition, which you will experience on others.

De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision and of the setting of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	If the incision is made due to an internal or external cause, or if you have already treated the corruption with medicines and the treatment does not work, or if the corruption persists without any apparent cause, then it is necessary that you make an incision in that member to the depth of the corruption, so that the patient may escape by that way either from death or from a greater evil than the loss of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that patient is that the member becomes black before it is burned, or if it swells around the black area until the gangrene enters that member and consumes the entire body, therefore take care to make an incision on that.

And if the corruption or the injury is at the end of the finger, then you cut the finger and do not leave space for the corruption to enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if you access the hand, then you cut it at the wrist and do not leave space for the corruption to enter into the arm.

E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	If corruption occurs and the joint swells, then it is the death of the patient; administering another cause in treatment is as effective as nothing.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similar to the foot when corruption swells the aforementioned part of the foot, then you should make an incision into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	If there is a lump on the foot, then you should make an incision along the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it grows into the calf, then you should make an incision into the calf at the joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	If corruption has already reached the calf, there is no remedy but to release it and allow the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of incising a limb or sewing it up is to tighten the ligament beyond the part you wish to incise, and then tighten another ligament at the site; extend a ligament below, and extend another ligament above; separate the flesh between the two ligaments with a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; and then make the incision or sew it up.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	It is necessary to place gauze on all the parts to keep them dry, and bring the dressing and cautery to the patient adjusted and sterile.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs during the procedure, you should cauterize the site or apply some hemostatic powder to stop the bleeding; then return to your treatment when it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the affected limb with a ligament appropriate to the injury, and care for it until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	This pain in the man's foot, which occurs due to an event similar to burning coal, you and I recommend that he apply this remedy we mention.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	This initial corruption tends to spread throughout the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Therefore, that man should prepare himself by applying heat to the affected foot with intensity sufficient to relieve the pain and burning sensation, and immerse the foot in hot water, allowing it to heal.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that remedy will have caused the corruption in the affected hand as well.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	Therefore, go to me and have that excess remedy removed from the hand, and perform cleansing on the body, so as not to let the excess spread to the other foot before it started in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	He called upon me to amputate his hand, but I did not wish to do so, fearing the spread of that excess and moreover dreading the death of the patient due to his poor condition.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	But when he gave up on me, he returned to his land and informed me that the man prepared and had his entire hand amputated, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have not related this narrative without purpose, but to offer assistance on the matter of this disease, and as a signification by which it may be recognized and treated accordingly.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Regarding care for the anus and quality of cleansing with medications.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy part of the body and the space of the abscess is prolonged before drainage occurs, it should be broken and perforated, allowing the pus to drain out, leaving a cavity similar to a vessel, covered with fine linen, and not allowed to become corrupted again or press on bone, nerve, or ligament. This condition is called a sinus and is not referred to as a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space becomes prolonged before corruption sets in any member, it is then called a fistula and not recognized as such.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment is that the cavity should be completely removed and especially when it is made thin like fabric, ensuring that it does not adhere to the location due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the cavity adheres and that the corruption has not yet been completed, and in the cavity there is a swelling of the face, then you should treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	You should consider the sinus and if it is large and emits a fetid odor, then enema with an Egyptian medicine made of oil, wine, and garlic, which has been divided into portions and placed in a container, and heated over the fire until the medicine becomes a rosy color and achieves its specific effect.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	You should take from it what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; then enema with that solution the sinus, and tighten the orifices of it, and leave the medicine inside for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	You should also remove that with care; do this for several days until the sinus is cleansed and the odor is eliminated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Sometimes it is enema with ashes water when this medicine is not present, and you should take the ash from the wood, put it in the water, and then strain that and enema it into the sinus until you feel assured that the sinus has been sealed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or ashes water, then enema with honey and garlic juice diluted, or wine and honey mixed, for honey has the property of cleansing and washing, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when the wine contains excess strength and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this for several days and feel assured that the sinus has been healed, then perform an enema with a solution that makes the flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	You should take digestive oil of roses and dissolve it in a mixture of white wine and tincture of spices, or perform an enema with various medications and remedies that I have mentioned in the treatise on enemas.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	If the orifice of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the cannula for the enema, you should gradually widen it with a small iron tool, and pause when you feel that it has been expanded enough, covered with Egyptian oil or basilica oil until it is fully expanded.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	Similarly, if the orifice is wide, you should sew the lips of it with stitches and leave a quantity within it that does not allow the enema to flow out.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	If the orifice of the sinus from which the fistula comes is raised at the ends above it, you should dry that area where the pus collects so that the fistula can run out below, for when the fistula is blocked in the sinus, the flesh will grow there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	If it is not possible for you to dry the sinus inside the bone as desired, you should be prepared that you will prepare the member with the preparation needed for the fistula to run out easily as appropriate and without being retained by any cause of the fistula.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take medications that are to be applied on the sinus appropriately, according to what you wish to extend it over cloth of him.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	The cloth should be of the same size as the communication of the entire sinus; then, with the forceps, incise in the right of the sinus orifice a small hole wider than the orifice itself, and extend it over another cloth from the edges of the lions according to the size of the incision, and place it on top of it for a distance away from the sinus orifice to alleviate the pain in the arm and not let the cloth be too large, but change it after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	The one that is over the sinus orifice should be washed at all times to prevent anything that is near the arm from becoming infected.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so you may know if what comes out of the arm is little or much, whether it digests, or does not digest.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And so you must consider the location of that sinus, if the patient feels pain there or not, and whether there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that has been discharged from the sinus already adheres or becomes attached to it, then you should loosen or separate it on the third day, and when you separate the wound, you change the cloth for another and renew the dressing.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu. And if the sinus has been discharged for many days and the arm is not digesting, you should know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and prolonged, you should dry out the medications, and if the medications are wet in their substance and in their effect, they become as drying as ointments like diaphinicon when they are applied excessively.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last thing is that you take diaphinicon ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and add an ancient remedy for the stomach to its substance, and combine this with the previous one, and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems like this action when there is no arm, use diaphinicon ointment, honey that is cooked until thickened and apply it; or take myrrh, aloe and sage, crush them all and powderize over the heated honey, and line this over cloth and strengthen it on the sinus; and line this with the honey that you have heated until thickened, and powderize over cloth and strengthen it.

De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Treatment of breadcrumbs, nail filing and cutting the finger nail, and incision.

Breadcrumbs are an abscess that comes from the nail of the finger on the hand or foot, and it is strong in other places, and when it is prolonged and its cure is expensive, or it becomes an abscess cauterized, or corrupted, and discharges pus into the arm until it rots the root of the nail, and it corrupts completely, and it carries its corruption to the bone until it smells fetid, and the end of the finger becomes rotten, and the color of it is made dark.

But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail compress the flesh at its joints, it begins to swell and inflame, then you must stop the pus that comes out near the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, and apply a thin needle under the nail that pierces the flesh, and press it out with ease, and place over what remains of the flesh from the corrosive medicines until it is all washed away; and treat it with ointments until it is healed.

Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	A more adjusted one, born in the hands of some men, it is very fatty throughout the flesh, and it is very fatty in its bones, or it is very fatty in its nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born near the joint [or hinge], or their nature is in some knuckles of the mentioned ones.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But the one that is born in the knuckles of the finger is not ill, and the one that is born near the joint is very ill.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	The incision of blemishes are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are varicosities, and they are thick enveloped veins full of melancholic fluids that come in the motes of the members of the body, and the greater danger is in the legs, especially in the legs of the itinerants, the laborers, and the carriers.

Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The healing of theirs with iron is according to two methods: the first is that it is incised and the black blood is drawn out, and the second method is that the vein is elevated and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision of it is according to this method: at the beginning you bind the leg with warm water into which the thick blood is resolved, that is feculent from the leg, and then tighten the patient's leg at the upper part of the thigh towards the lower part of the crotch with a bandage, and then incise the vein in one place or two or three places with a wide incision, and raise the black blood with the strongest force of the hand from below the leg towards above, until the amount that you want to extract and have taken has been removed, and this will remove the power of the illness.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And tell him (the patient) to abstain from foods that generate black bile.

The elevation of theirs is according to this method: you must raise the leg of the patient, if there are motes in it, and place him in a warm bath and bind his leg with warm water until it swells and the veins are overflowing; or exercise it with strong exercises, if bath is not available, until the member is heated.

And lift it and incise the lower incision, and extract it and raise it until it is removed through the second incision, and extract it from the incision that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela. And if the life is contracted with tortuosity in which there is envelopment at the divisions, and it is not as it should be according to what we have said, then it is necessary that you cut through that entire tortuosity of it and the places of its envelopment, and suspend it with sutures inside until it is raised.

Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Make an incision with which the life is cut off:
Forma de unci orp:	Form a purse-string suture:

De extraccio venae cruris.	Extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is born in the thighs in cold lands such as Egypt in the lands of Arabs and in the southern and arid lands of India, where there is little water and where neither herbs nor wheat grow.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section over worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called bovine disease in some places because it often enters into cattle and is a worm that is born between the intestine and the flesh, and goes up and down throughout the body, and is manifested by sensation of member to member until it bursts the intestine and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is by the putrefaction of some fluids such as worms, snakes, lice and scabies in the abdomen.

And it is feared because of the malice of it, for when it enters the body and rises to the head, it reaches the brain, then strong evil smells enter it and destroy the brain, and this often happens.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, do not do so unless its movement and manifestation in the body by sensation are known, and then it is necessary that you strengthen what is over it and what is underneath it with ligation and compression, and approach it dry and extract it.

If you see this arrive at the head near the brain, strengthen over the forehead with strong compression, and approach it dry, and extract it; and it is necessary that the patient uses purification of his body with medicines evacuating putrid fluids and guard himself from foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	From section on swelling of the navelf (or navel)
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is known in our land as the "navelf," and it causes pain in various body parts, which can spread from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen what I am about to recommend.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, where I found that her arm had swollen and there was a small inflammation in the basilic vein of her arm, which had burst for an hour, and then I saw this inflammation go up like living silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then wait for the pain to subside in that location and settle into the muscle, and stay there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And correct any other faults found in the opposite shoulder towards the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	I recommend that you rotate the entire body as I saw, and it was very surprising to see how the exchange and speed of limbs took place.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I have seen before in the highest heavens such exchange as described by this method, but I have also seen others who suffer pain from the exchange of limbs.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I do not see this happening in women as I described before.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not think that this is the case unless the woman was old, where the body and veins were dry, and in this situation, the sensation of windiness becomes apparent.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that it does not appear according to this treatment in those who are indulgent and have bodies with moist veins weakened.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	If you want to cure that condition and the patient feels pain, do not perform this procedure in the manner I described before, but rather strengthen it slightly and dry it internally until the constriction of the windiness subsides, then cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see this happening in your veins, then you cure that condition through the use of excision of the body and the expulsion of windiness, and administer pills made with wormwood and Serapion root, among others.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On extracting boils.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Boils are differentiated according to their species, and the areas of the body where they occur, as they have different shapes: some with large points, small, concave, sunken, solid ones; others with three angles, those that have tongues; and those that are stalks.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which relates to the members and the pains in which it happens according to two manners: for the members or are primary members such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, hernias, bladder, and their similarities; and thus when it happens in any of these primary members and signs of death appear to you, I recommend avoiding extraction of that arrow in those cases where death is imminent for the one in whom the signs are clear, and when such symptoms do not appear to you, and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then you extract it and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And as for the symptoms of the skull, when an arrow strikes it and passes through the bone, and exits at the base which is above the brain, this happens violently with headaches, blindness, dizziness, fever in the cheeks, inflammation and fever of the tongue, convulsions and confusion of thought, vomiting of bile, and the word is easily lost and the voice destroyed, and there is discharge from the wound of white pus similar to powder, and eyes like water from the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore, if such symptoms appear to you, then do not attempt treatment or extraction of the arrow, unless it is necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	However, the symptoms of an arrow in the heart, which is near the left nipple and feels hard to touch, are not empty but filled; the movement of the arrow feels like the movement of a pulse, blood flows from the wound that is black, there is coldness at the extremities, excessive sweating, and fainting; therefore, you know that death approaches quickly.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	The symptoms of an arrow in the lung are primarily sputum from the wound that is frothy blood, and the vessels near the neck are compressed, and the patient's complexion changes, and they breathe heavily and demand cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrow strikes the membrane located in the foot, and the pain is mainly in the small ribs, it causes severe pain with deep breathing and sighing, and not all of the member's muscles are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	If the arrow strikes the stomach, then a foul-smelling discharge comes from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	If the arrow strikes the abdomen and is buried inside, there may be a hole in the wound, or tissues such as intestines or hernias that have been torn apart, and there is no hope for recovery from extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	If the arrow strikes the bladder and comes out with urine, and there are signs of bleeding outside, and strong pain is felt by the patient, then you know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	However, other members such as the head, neck, throat, shoulders and joints, spine, cervical vertebrae, pelvis, hips, and their similar parts of the body can be saved if the arrow does not pierce a vein or artery and is not poisonous.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	I recommend that you pay attention to the nature of these arrows, as this indicates the method of treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason is that when an arrow hits a man in the tear duct of the eye at the root of the nose, and it is extracted from the other side, leaving the eyelash behind, healing occurs and no harm is done to the eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And another arrow was extracted from a Jew who had been hit in the eye at the root, leaving behind the eyelid, and the arrow had already been hidden, but could only be found by a small tip attached to its shaft, and it was a sharp arrow of Turkish arrows with lion-shaped heads without feathers.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew was saved, and no harm was done to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And another arrow was extracted from a Christian who had been hit in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow with feathers; therefore, I made two incisions on each side of the throat, and the arrow was already submerged in the throat of the patient; then I softened it and carefully extracted it, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had been hit in the stomach, and I thought he would die because of it; but since thirty days had passed without any change in his condition due to his disposition, I made an incision on it and cut into it, and he recovered, and no further harm came to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	I saw another man who had been hit by an arrow in the back, and the wound had healed over time, and after about six years it came out through the opening of the spine.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.
