I saw a woman who had been hit by an arrow in the stomach, and the wound healed over time, but it did not change in any of her natural functions, and she suffered no harm in any of her operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	I saw another man who had been hit by an arrow in the face, and the wound healed over time, but the arrow was removed without causing further pain, and similar symptoms occurred.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the nose of the prince of the king, which was in the middle of his nostril and had declined slightly to the right side, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	You were summoned for treatment near the casement of the arrow for three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then you probed the wound of the arrow, but it was narrow and you did not feel it; however, you felt the puncture below the right ear, so you suspected that the puncture was from the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	You spread the area with an ointment containing attracting and digestive properties, so that it would indicate the location of the arrow for me, so I could cut through it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	I did not find an accident that indicated the location of the arrow; I continued to apply the ointment for many days, but did not find an indication; however, the wound healed in the meantime, and after several days the patient felt the arrow in his nose and reported this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then you cover the wound with a strong corrosive medicine for several days until pus comes out; and with the probe you can feel if it is thin, and then extract the tip of the arrow which is attached to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then you carefully arrange the opening of the wound with that strong corrosive medicine until it is visible to me the tip of the arrow, and wait for my instructions for the period of time up to four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound has become swollen and it is possible for me to insert forceps into it, you hold it in place without moving, and I will not stop trying to extract it using various methods of engineering until one day I begin to use forceps designed specifically for this purpose to pull it out gently as described at the end of the chapter; and then restore the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Some physicians thought that the cartilage of the nose was not restored and I restored it, and the wound healed completely, and the patient recovered without any complications.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend the method of extracting certain arrows according to this rule and this explanation, which does not cover everything that I have not mentioned, because the parts of this art and the difficulties of it are not understood through narration or reading these books.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	The wise artisan understands much with little; and from what is presented, he understands about what is absent; and it is necessary to adapt operations and new instruments when unexpected problems occur in the course of the art.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not forgotten in the limbs where they are inserted, but rather in two ways: either by attraction to the location of the wound; or by the opposite side of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And an arrow that is shot into a location where it entered will either be made of flesh or bone and will be shot and forgotten.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not catch it immediately at the time of shooting, it is necessary that you leave it for several days until the flesh around it can be cut and the attraction and exit reduced.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And if it is shot into bone and you do not catch it immediately, it is necessary to leave it for several days and move it with attraction every day until it is forgotten.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	If you do not catch it immediately, it is necessary that after several days, you perforate around the arrow in all parts of the bone with a very fine drill until the area is expanded by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	If the arrow is shot into the bone of the head and has already passed through one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of these symptoms appear in the patient which I have mentioned, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of the arrow and leave it until his life is stabilized for several days; because if the arrow reaches the brainstem, death is not prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is not shot but only into the bone of the skull and does not reach the brainstem, and the patient remains for several days without any cause of those symptoms, you use engineering to attract the arrow and the shaft.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is not shot and cannot be extracted, you administer various treatments around the arrow as recommended, and care for the wound until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow has already been hidden in the body and is no longer felt, you probe it with a probe, and if you feel it, you shoot it out with appropriate instruments for attraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	If you cannot get above it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the probe, and here is not bone or nerve or vein, you make an incision over the wound until it is expanded enough to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if the ears are inflamed and must be treated, then you should release the flesh in which they are embedded from all sides with every tool you can use; and devise on this, if you cannot on the evacuation of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and twisting of them until it becomes necessary.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the removal of the splinter in any place where it is, then you should use twisting of your hand with forceps on all sides until it becomes necessary; and carefully with delicate subtlety ensure that the splinter is not broken, and made to be difficult for it to escape and for that extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot perform that at your time, then you should leave it for several days until the surrounding parts can heal, and apply something that will alleviate it.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	However, if the flow of blood occurs contrary to this, then you should administer what has been mentioned for treatment in its own chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Keep your skill in the incision of veins or nerves, or tendons, and provide all possible means for the evacuation of the splinter; do this with ease, calmness, patience, and firmness as I and you recommend.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, you should oppose the splinter so that the patient is positioned according to the figure in which the splinter should be extracted, as it is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	However, if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	However, if the splinters are situated on the opposite side of another part, or if they have caused damage to surrounding parts, or if there is inflammation outside the wound and it becomes apparent; then you should seek out that area; and make an incision according to the size that forceps can grasp, and apply pressure on it, as it will be made to emerge easily.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	However, if it is held in the bone, then you should twist the knife counterclockwise until the splinter enters the bone, and widen the area around it, and apply pressure to extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for several days and apply something over it until it comes out.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the splinter is in that one, then you should push it out with something.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	However, if the shaft is cut and you wish to administer impulse, then insert it and push it down, if it is numb, strike a concave instrument into it so that it enters the concavity of the splinter and apply pressure on it with something.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	However, if the splinter is convex, then you should push it out with a strong instrument that penetrates it, as the splinter will be relieved by this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the splinter is entangled, then you must flatten all the flesh around it, if this is possible for you, and apply something to it that is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the needle catches in the foot, or in the abdomen, or in the bladder, or in the ribs, and it is near to the point that you can touch it with the probe and it is possible for you to extract it, then extract it and guard against incision of vein or nerve, and suture the wound if necessary, and heal it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Use a pair of forceps to draw out the needles:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Make them like the beaks of birds, made with saw when they are grasped onto the needle so that it is not lost.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And from those are made small, large, few or many, depending on the size and scantiness of the needle, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Make the convex end of this concave one like the tip of a bird's beak in such a way that it eases the insertion of the needle into it, and push on the other end softly.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Make the convex end of the convex one:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Make a hole in the concave part of the needle, and push it through with the rod.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of phlebotomy, which are customarily bled through the cube.30. which are located in the head, sixteenth part of a cubit. So are two pulsating veins that are near the ears, say this: these are the two herbs that are apparent in both temples; and two veins that are in the two tear ducts of the eyes called 'aspient' veins; and the vein prepared in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the end of the nose; and two glands that are at the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and these are the veins that are called 'anglic' veins; and these are the veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that are to be lanced in the arms are .v. (vena basilica) For one of those is a cephalic, and it must be let blood with wild lettuce; the people call it "the vein of the head", and it is deaf, and it is a superficial vein, and it is composed of one branch of the basilica, and another branch of the cephalic; and they name that one "the vein of the whole body", and basilica is the vein which is let blood in the domestic artery, and is named "cubital", and the vulgar people call it "vein of the belly"; the biceps brachii, and is located on the cubital fossa, and is the one that is punctured, and is the one that appears above the pulse for a clear appearance; and the cephalic vein, and it is between the greater and lesser cubital veins.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg there are three veins: one of those is below the bend of the cubital fossa; the second is saphenous, and the location of it is below the bend of the domestic artery; the sciatic vein, and the location of it is below the bend of the cubital fossa; and in the leg there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The advantage of the veins that are near the ears is that they help with ancient catarrhs, migraines, headaches, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those veins is according to what I recommend for you: it should be scraped the patient's head, and the patient's head should be rubbed in the occipital region where both veins are located with a clean cloth with good friction; hold the patient's neck tightly with a bandage so that they appear in two places on each side of the head; and seek those with your own hand, and if you feel the pulse of those with your own hand, here is the test.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Take the cutting lancet, which is sharp-pointed, and insert it below the vein into the cavity until blood flows out of the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And lift your hand with the vein and the cavity towards the joint above it, and incise (puncture) the vein with an incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be adjusted to two fingers, or around that amount; and make the blood flow out as much as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And hold it firmly with your fingers and press it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And it has been previously mentioned at the beginning of this treatise the incision of those and their cauterization (sealing with heat or caustic agents).
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But from the two arterial veins that are in the temples, the advantage of bloodletting is for old chronic migraines and maladies of the eyes, and ailments of the head with acute fluid accumulation around the eyes.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of bloodletting those is according to what I recommend for you: constrain the patient's neck and move it until both veins appear clearly and manifestly, and demonstrate the pulse of them with your own hand; then perform the test (venipuncture).
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	Approach you raise the bandage above the vein at the groin as indicated, insert the lancet into the incised area below, lift the vein upwards; and incise it in the same manner as you have done in the other two veins; and make the blood flow according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Approach you release the patient's arterial constriction, and place your finger on the vein for an hour, then place your hand over that area and knead it firmly, leaving it in place until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	Here is the translation: And now let us remember them, and mark their incision, and draw attention to the beginning of the treatise.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	Therefore, the treatment of venous lancet for the vein of the forehead is similar to the treatment of the superficial temporal vein in ancient facial diseases such as migraines, headaches, abscesses and putrid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of lancing is according to what I recommend to you; namely, that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage until the vein appears; and then take the instrument called a trepan which has this shape:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Place the puncture point at the end of the trepan on the vein and strike it downwards or in another manner as described, allowing the blood to flow according to the quantity you desire; then release the perforation of the patient and leave it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	On some occasions it is opened with a lancet, but it is not necessary that the lancet be of an acute tip like other lancets; rather, it should have a blunt tip, and lance it transversely, for the bone is close and strong, so if the lancet is thin, it may break the bone when it is sharp.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the treatment of the two veins that are in the eyelids due to scabs from the eyes caused by migraines and abscesses in the eyes, and facial diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of lancing is that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage, and you should lance them, and you should be standing over his head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the lancing should be done transversely across a small area and with few strokes, for there is not much flesh in that location; if the lancet is thin, it may break its tip.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Allow the blood to flow as much as you need, press on that area and hold it for a short time, then release it.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But the lancing of the nasal vein is given for acute fever and strong sweating, as well as facial diseases, migraines, and abscesses that occur in the face, especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of lancing is that the patient tightens his neck and approaches your left hand to his nose, and takes a thin, long lancet and places it in the middle of the nostril as directed, for the vein is not felt here, and blood begins to flow immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	You should close the wound little by little and allow the blood to flow according to your need; then hold it for a short time, as the wound heals easily.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the treatment of lancing both eyes leads to constriction, leprosy beginning, and various other diseases and infections, as well as corrosive ulcers such as herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of lancing those is that the patient tightens each one in his neck loosely; and the craftsman should be standing over the head of the patient, and the patient should sit on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And make a long incision on the vein with a wide, shallow lancet; and extract blood according to measured quantity or as necessary; and make it similar to the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And release the ligaments and tighten both veins with moderate constriction so that the patient is not overheated, and leave it to mature until the wound is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	The treatment of lancing veins in the area near the ear confers small abscesses and pustules of the mouth, decay of gums, bad ulcers, and fissures, as well as bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of lancing those is that you should place the patient facing you, tighten his neck with a bandage, retract his lips and observe both veins, one of which is on the right lip and the other on the left; and the demonstration of each one is by the darkness of each of them, and this is more so because around those veins there are small black veins; and then incise each one with an incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you are uncertain, and do not know which one it is, then incise the larger of the two, and from the pus present.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make them similar to the veins in the upper lip.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But it is more common to incise both veins that are in the lower lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	The two veins that are placed nearby the tongue assist in phlebotomy of the carotid artery during prophylaxis for epilepsy and in the treatment of diseases of the uvula, as well as mouth diseases.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	The quality of phlebotomy in this case is that the patient lies down with their head slightly elevated and their tongue lowered, and you should look at the vein from one side and the other side, and the color of each vein is darkening towards blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	Then phlebotomize each vein, and be careful not to pierce through them as they are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	The veins that are phlebotomized in the elbow are those in which there is blood flow for all men, and the method of phlebotomy for them is done in two ways, either with a mirtilat or olive mixture made thinly; or by cutting with a phlebotomizing knife, and it is called alnessil, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	This alnessil is that which should be done by making an incision of the specified length and subtlety according to the width of the veins and the narrowness of those vessels.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of mirtil phlebotomy:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	The first sentence is: "If the pulses are as large and visible as often happens, it is necessary to open the concave veins full of blood that appear swollen, and to these which contain thick clotted blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	Here's the translation for the given line in English: "And this is the procedure for lancing an olive:". The previous sentences were translations from the provided text.
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this lancing is smaller and with a thin tip, and it is necessary to perform fine vein lancing that contains thin citrus juice blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	Furthermore, the lancing of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins, drains the blood from the sick areas that are located in the neck and back, and of that which purifies the feet and abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	It is necessary for the lancer to be cautious when performing lancing, as there is an artery nearby, and if it should be touched or punctured during lancing, the artery will be cut and blood will flow, so it must not be lanced with a sharp instrument, but rather sliced like a slice of bread.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	If the basilic vein does not appear due to a clear manifestation, then it is necessary that you locate it and switch to another one or search for its branches; or lance in the area at the end of the arm, as this is visible; slice it with a lancing instrument like a slice of bread as mentioned before.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you want to lance the median cubital vein, then it is necessary to be in front of the bend of the arm and find the location between where you know the pulse is located, and hold it with a cloth; place your hand on it and locate the vein with a concave incision using a lancing instrument like a slice of bread as mentioned before, and be careful not to miss the area near the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you feel the tenderness of the pulse, press in the location that you have marked with a cloth, and that pressure is on the artery, so it swells and should be avoided.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	If you see blood flow during the lancing like the urine of a child, and the blood is thin and red, then you know it is from an artery; place your thumb and forefinger on it for a long time; remove your thumb, and if the blood is severed, as it often happens, tighten the arm and let go.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	Take care of the patient to avoid wetting them, be cautious with them and do not let them move for several days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	If the blood is not severed and there is no medicine available, then you should cut the artery if it appears; as its end will contract and the blood will be cut off; or take scissors, cut the wound, and take a piece of cloth and tightly compress the area near the vein with pressure and pulse for another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	If the blood is severed, that's good; and if it is not, then take care of it with the remedy that follows the location of the powders causing bleeding.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	The draining of blood from the wound is difficult due to its small size and the possibility of the arm's pulse.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	Lancing the dark vein is beneficial as it drains blood from the supracranial portion of the head and the region below the chest; since it is composed of branches of the basilic vein and the cephalic vein, as mentioned before.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	It is necessary for the lancer to be cautious during the lancing of a vein, as there is a nerve nearby; and if it touches or punctures the nerve during lancing, it will result in numbness, which makes healing difficult and recovery slow; sometimes this nerve appears with sensation, and if it is hidden in some people and is thin and not easily visible, it is necessary to pause the lancing using a slicing instrument, avoiding the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	If the vein is between two nerves, then you should make an incision along its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of lancing the cephalic vein is that it drains blood from the head and relieves headaches.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	In this way, if you want to lance using a lancing instrument for an olive or a myrtle, as all the blood is saved, since there is neither an artery nor a nerve present.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is necessary that you perform the lancing so as not to hit the tip of the finger with the lancing instrument only, and look for a lighter location, and do not notice it if it is not touched by the first percussion that occurs during the lancing in some cases.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, a hard lump may appear in some people when it is not lanced during the first percussion, but it will not be noticed in the recurrence.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	The quality of the lancing and its complications are many, for which it is necessary to consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you must know that lancing is not administered except for the preservation of health and with hope for improvement and caution against illness, and that lancing should be performed on one of the three veins that are in the elbow, namely: cephalic, dark, and basilic; and that it should be performed at the beginning of spring, after fasting during spring and autumn, and in winter near meals, when there are signs of swelling.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And if it is to be done, let there be phlebotomy [bloodletting] on the third day or at the first pulse that has occurred after three hours have passed from the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But it should be administered when there is a need for it, or whether it is night or day, in any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	It is necessary that the child should not be bled before it has reached 14 years of age, and a woman who is pregnant should not be bled except during the fourth month up to the seventh, and old women should not be bled who have already passed 60 years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be bled in any way, it is necessary to clean the intestines before bleeding with a lion's clyster [enema], if there is an open wound retained, so that the superfluous fluid does not enter the veins during the bleeding of the intestines, which are pure, and that they do not go to the main organs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And it should not be bled those who are ill with seasickness or gluttony, nor those afflicted by illness or drunkenness until the ailment has passed, nor someone suffering from dropsy, but rather bleeding should be feared in relation to colic pain and vomiting, abdominal pain, multiplication of sexual desire and labor, exercise of fasting or vigils, and any cause that weakens strength, either bodily or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And in consideration of the subtlety of the fluids beforehand if the blood is thick, with food and drinks, and with medications if it is possible to do so.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into the bath if there is no cause to prevent it, or exercise for any exercise to make the blood thin.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	Stop bleeding from the legs during the day, namely around third hour, just as has been said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And perform that the foot should be guarded on that day from all animal accidents, such as anxiety, anger, fear and from all bodily accidents, such as labor and excessive pain and sexual desire and similar to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And in the case of a woman, let there be present the causes for which it is customary among men to use aromatics and fragrances and balms and similar to these according to the amount of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the one who is to be bled with a pulse or that of the patient who needs to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And extract the arm, and feel it with your own hand, the one who is to be bled, two or three times; and tighten the ligature with ropes or bands and wrap it twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And the ligature should be tightened, for if the ligature is not tight enough, or the ligature is excessive, then prevent blood flow; or if it is softening, then immediately prevent the heart from beating.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And the ligature, it is necessary that the one who needs to be bled feel his own hands between them until the veins are inflamed and can be felt.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And the one who is to bleed anoints his bleeding spot with a little of ancient oil specifically; and pause your left hand on that vein, over the place where the bloodletting is to be done, so that a small amount of blood flows out, and the percussion should cease because some of the veins behave like cords and flee when the bleeding is to be done, and those are the ones that are filled with vitality and when you pause the bleeding over them, they contract and are discovered; and the bloodletting does not open the vein, and if it opens, that is tightened.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, it is necessary that the one who is to bleed should be fixed and carefully considered in all these matters.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And pause the bleeding, but if the vein is cut in one examination, then it is good; otherwise, you repeat the examination a little later, or quickly if the location is not marked.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the location is marked or the patient feels pain, leave it for a day or two and do not tighten the ligature, because excessive heat will cause an abscess to form, nor enter into the bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And repeat the bloodletting if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the opening is small and the blood flows thinly, and you fear that there will not be enough blood, then you repeat the bloodletting in the same place according to the rule and adjust the opening a little, and do so quickly before the location is marked, because when it is marked in many men, make only a few incisions.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if it has already been marked, then do not repeat on the same place, for there is no excuse to you in any cause; and pause over some part of the oil incision, because it relieves the heart of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better at this location with oil than with other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And administer an oil incision in all bloodletting where you are prohibited from beating the heart, and do it tracheotomy (tyriaca) when it is stopped on one of them over the location, for the blood is made thin and is turned when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess is generated at the site of bloodletting, which often happens, and more so in one who has not been bled for some time or in the incision of a vein with little opening, then take cotton, and pour sponge infused in water and salt, a little scalded, over it and tighten it for an hour, as it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And it must be done to bring the yellowish part of that vein or another vein into contact with it.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	If a black or green discoloration remains in the area for some days, do not notice it; and if you wish, apply some cause of alienation and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of mint juice or calamint or something similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times abscesses and protrusions occur, you must perform a lancing of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand on it, and if you notice that the area becomes soft, you must apply pressure to it; if the protrusion is bad and malicious, then be careful to place some cause of what has been mentioned on it, because strong blood will flow from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Apply a plaster with a substance that has astringent properties, so that the area is hardened; and care for it with another remedy until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	It is necessary to extract blood from every person according to the quantity of its virtue and the color it takes on in the blood, depending on what appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	If the blood is black, you must allow it to settle until it turns red; if the blood appears thick, you must allow it to settle until it becomes thin; and if it is sharp (acute), you must preserve its sharpness.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	To the person who is full and strong and has a need for bloodletting on a certain day, the lancing of the vein should be made larger, and the lancet should be long.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	In a weak person, the opposite of that should be done; and in that case, bloodletting should be performed too often, and the instrument used to let blood should be tight.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	The best method for venous lancing is a transverse section rather than a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of venous lancing avoids blood flow and nerve injury, and is safer than lancing according to latitude (north-south) and longitude (east-west).
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	When fainting is likely to occur, venous lancing should be done; and before doing so, you must treat the person with a small amount of pennyroyal infusion in white vinegar or simple warm scalded oxymel, and let blood three or four times.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	If there is congestion in the chest, you must take something before venous lancing to infuse with myrrh syrup or aromatic honey with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar ones, or with aromatic and fragrant syrup and oil.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	If fainting occurs, venous lancing should be done, and the cause of this is likely due to too much blood; in that case, you must drink water from meat and a subtle fragrant syrup; use aromatics in some way, and limit their weight on your feet with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	Use the other causes that were mentioned in the chapter on fainting for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	If someone wants to reduce the size of their arm and dissolve their blood every day, it is necessary for that person who requires venous lancing as a strong evacuation method, and its virtue is gentle; it will gradually dissolve blood according to the quantity of its virtue in consecutive days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But if someone wants to reduce the size of their arm and expel blood several times, and their body is strong, do so approximately seven or eight hours after the first venous lancing.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But if someone wants to direct the blood from their body in the opposite direction of where it normally flows, it must be done on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But in a body where there is already much hot blood that is sharp and causes fever, it must be expelled from the body once and a large amount must be expelled with an enlarged opening until fainting occurs; then you will have preserved all the conditions of venous lancing, and you should place your hand on the pulse of the blood to prevent death in the event of fainting. However, several times it happens when the person performing venous lancing is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	When you wish to release the arm and drain the blood as observed, since the orifices of the vein are closed and it is difficult to draw blood, press firmly upon that area while gently extending it, for that is very harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Leave it be until it is ready for second venesection; or let the vein's coagulation of blood in the orifice subside; or pause over that with a lancet, or leech, and apply a light compression to it until the blood has come out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is swollen, let it be and do not touch it until the swelling subsides.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	If there is a need to draw blood a second time and it is not an excuse, then make an incision on that area or in the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "the cord of the arm" is venesectioned at the crook or the basilica, when it is not shrunken or hidden, for it consists of these two.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the venesection is that the patient immerses his hand in warm water until the needle becomes swollen and the vein appears prominently.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then apply pressure firmly with a tight bandage and make the venesection transversely, not longitudinally or obliquely.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	The incision should be wide and your venesection on that joint of the hand, make it small.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is forbidden, immerse your hand in warm water and let the blood flow into the water until you achieve your goal.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, you are exempt from immersing your hand in warm water, and the flow of blood during winter is stopped by immersing the body in warm water.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the venesection of this vein is safer than that of all other veins, for there is neither a pulsating vein nor a nerve nearby.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	The venesection of the cephalic vein of the right hand is beneficial for liver disease.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	The quality of the venesection is that you apply pressure to the hand firmly or with your other hand, after it has been immersed in warm water, until the vein swells and becomes clearly visible to the eye; and make the incision transversely; and if it is not possible to find the vein completely, this will still be beneficial.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And remember not to injure your hand with the lancet, for it is where the tendons of the fingers are exposed without flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then immerse your hand in warm water and let the blood flow from it, for if you do not immerse your hand in warm water, the blood will clot in the vein's orifice, and the flow is forbidden.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when blood is drawn according to the required quantity, let it be paused on olive oil and salt so that it does not coagulate quickly; and similarly, this must be done in all narrow passages.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of venesection from that of the left hand is for gallbladder disease.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	Do the same in the venesection of this as you did in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of the saphenous vein's venesection is for diseases in the lower part of the body, such as uterine disease, retention of menstruation, and diseases of the nose and ulcers of the chest and abdomen, and similar to these conditions.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	The quality of the venesection is that the patient immerses his foot in warm water and makes friction over it until the veins become visible; and on the joint of the foot with a strap; and the location of the vein must be pointed out, and from there it should be followed to the face of the foot towards many branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, venesection should be performed widely along the arm or towards the leg, for it is better and more effective.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform venesection on the face of the foot, be careful of the nerves that are below it on the face of the foot, and pause your venesection with the incision you make transversely, as if you were about to make an oblique incision.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	Let the venesections be circular.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is forbidden, immerse your foot in warm water and let the blood flow from it until it is drained.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the venesector makes a mistake in the first observation, immerse it again with the lancet in the same place, for the location is safe; and do not fear the trickery, but be careful of the nerves as previously said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do the same with the other foot as well.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location should be similarly as we said, the heel must be placed under the wild thigh-bone.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	The assistance for the lancing of it is for back pain when due to blood clots.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The quality of the lancing is that the patient immerses in bath, and then tightens the back muscles from the lower part of the spine to the heel, four fingers' width above it, under a long, thin bandage, as it will not appear otherwise.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	Therefore, when it appears, you do the lancing according to your skill and depending on the transverse direction, and that is better; or insert it with an incision or cut it with a section, as the place is dry.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	It is in many men who are not weakened; and if that disappears without being felt, you do the lancing of a branch of it, and that which appears on the back of the foot near the ear and the ankle.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Be careful with the nerves, and make the blood flow as much as you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Release the constriction and place on the site of the lancing, pressing the area, as it heals easily.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventosection and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventosections are for corns, or eruptions, or verrucae.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventosection is performed in two ways: one of them is by scoring and extraction of blood, and the other is ventosection without scoring.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	The ventosection without scoring can be done in two ways: either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	The ventosections with scoring and extraction of blood are in twelve parts of the body, among which one where ventosections are applied is the ankle, and it is the last part of the leg; and the middle part of the neck; and ventosections of the chin just below the jawbone; and ventosections of both arms; and ventosections of the shoulder; and ventosections of two feet; and ventosections of two shins; and ventosections of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Ventosection does not extract blood from the veins, but rather from the small scattered vessels in the flesh, and therefore it does not have the effect as achieved by lancing; nor is it necessary that ventosection be performed with fire or without fire in any disease caused by repletion before the entire body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	However, if it is necessary due to disease or constipation, administer that at any time at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle of it and at some time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in men, blood multiplies within them until it becomes necessary to extract it by ventosection and they become seriously ill; and of those who suffer from repletion and heat on their body and head, and neck; and of those who suffer from pruritus on the body and forehead, and darkness and dullness in the eyes; and of those who lose the site of their ventosection; and of those whose laughter is excessive; and of those who taste blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is protruded and spits blood; and of those whose sleep is increased, and of those who see blood while sleeping, old age, and other similar causes to them.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, when it happens in any of those cases, and particularly if it is in the third or fourth decade of the month, you command that ventosection be performed more than two or three hours after the day has passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the assistance for ventosection of the neck is that when it causes gravity in the head and causes sinking into the eyes; but it is necessary that this be accompanied by evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventosection is at the site of lancing of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not appropriate to use that which is of complete purge, or in which there is catarrh, as it causes great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore, it is not necessary to use that for the elderly or those with diseases of the head.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	However, for those who continue to suffer from it, it is done by forgetting; and therefore you command the ventosector to pause his hand a little on the ventosection at the sites, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	However, ventosection of the alveolar is at the site of lancing of the vein radialis and basilica: and therefore it causes asthma, constriction of the chest and scissuring of the stoma of the chest, coughing, repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary to be cautious with the ventosection of the alveolar, as if it is left alone, it generates weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And ventosection of the alveolar causes headaches and migraines, dizziness, nausea, pain in the roots of the teeth; and it is at the site of lancing of the vein basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary to command the ventosector not to press his hand with scoring so as not to incise the artery and cause blood flow.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	Swelling of the lower jaw is treated with alcohol in the mouth, and corruption of the gum, resembling diseases that are in the mouth, and they are located near incision for alveolar puncture on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	The swelling that is made on both cheeks is treated with cataplan, which is made by heating.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.
