Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jawbone is broken and the fracture is not associated with a plague, consider first whether the fracture is only on the outside, and if it is not broken in two and is curved at the edges inside, then its diagnosis is easy. (Note: "plagua" refers to an infection or ulcer.)
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side of the jawbone, you should insert your index finger (left hand) into the patient's mouth; and if the fracture is on the left jawbone, you should insert the index finger of your right hand; and you should press gently inward at the inner part of the fracture, while applying pressure outward on the edges of the bone with your other hand; doing this with care and evenly pressing both hands.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the jawbone fracture has already separated into two parts, then you should administer extension of both parts so that their alignment can be achieved as much as possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	If there is commotion of teeth to disruption (loose teeth), you should bind those that you hope will remain with gold or silver wire or gut; and place cotton over the fractured jawbone, and a double layer of cloth, and a broad strip of well-made cloth, or a single piece of gauze the length of the jawbone; and tie it up as necessary for the healing process, so that it is not destroyed. (Note: "cot" refers to cotton.)
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And tell the patient to rest and remain calm, and restrict their intake of sour foods (lemon).
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you suspect that the figure has been altered in some way, then examine it and loosen it on the third day; and correct any deformity with powder of milled rice, alum, or chalk flour (calcium carbonate); as you have removed the cotton, place wool over the dressing. (Note: "terra" refers to clay.)
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And thus, when the dressing has been applied and the bone alignment is not altered, leave it in place until it is healed and strengthened (the fracture), as this fracture often takes three weeks to heal.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	If another boil appears again, administer the same treatment as previously described until it is healed and the boil is drained. (Note: "remaugut" refers to drainage.)
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	If the fracture is associated with a plague, consider whether it is a bone fragment separated or osteitis (inflammation of the bone), and carefully remove those fragments with instruments suitable for the removal of such fragments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	If the orifices of the plague are narrow, you should enlarge them with a leeches (medieval medical instrument used for bloodletting) according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed the fragments, and there is no more pus draining from them, you should sew up the orifices of the plague if they are wide; otherwise, cover it with one of the dressings suitable for that purpose and let it heal.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V. (Note: in medieval manuscripts, each chapter was often preceded by its number, usually in Roman numerals.)
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the clavicle when it is fractured. (Note: "furcula" refers to the clavicle bone.)
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	For some time, the clavicle is broken at the front edge and this fracture can occur in one of three ways. (Note: "manieyra" refers to a way or manner.)
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken (fractured), separated, or separated into two parts other than osteitis (inflammation of the bone); and it is easy to restore; or because it occurs with osteitis, and restoration is difficult; or because the fracture is associated with a plague.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that, when the fracture is without wound, is that you make two ministers present, so that one holds the assistance and follows the broken neck, and the other extends the neck to that parted side.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then align the fracture with the teeth that the form may be made according to its shape, and it should not be in a hollow or concave position.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	If more extension is needed, then it is necessary that you place a support of fabric or wool over the patient's chest, and its size should be according to your need; stretch, lift and compress the neck and press the chest with your hand toward the fracture until it is aligned as required.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If you cannot pull the fracture's end out through the partition outside, which is necessary for the traction, then it is necessary that the patient is supine on their neck, and place a large size thumb or hand on one of the muscles.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the servant presses the muscle of it on the outside of the fracture until the bone of the neck is lifted to the traction point above, and then you correct the fracture and align it with the teeth.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If symptoms of the neck (pain) and swelling are felt, it is necessary that you cut through it and extract those symptoms with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	If it is retained in the bone, you make an incision through it with one of the incisors that you have prepared for this purpose, as you had placed the saw on the neck that serves for the chisel; and it is a chisel made of wood or iron, and its shape is like:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to the shape of a chisel, with its concavity facing downward; and let its width be according to your need, depending on the size of the bone or the hollowness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it should be according to what is possible in the operation; that it has two ends like this, and one end should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	If the wound caused by the incision that you made when extracting the swelling of the bone is wide and certain of pus, then you adjust the two lips of the wound with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the wound is small or you fear pus, then you fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the size of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If pus occurs, then you pour wine vinegar and rose oil over it.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	If the bone (neck or spine) is fractured without a wound and incision, then you place a plaster made of flour mixed with egg white on it, and place it on a thick leather pad, and place your hand over the area if it is necessary, and take human fat, which is called "torca" by the Saracens, that is long, and its width should be one palm or slightly more; and place double powders over the leather pad and the plaster; and take a thin wooden stick with a width of three fingers and wrap it in cloth, and wrap the cloth around the stick in the location above the fracture; and pour human fat as needed, and rub it over the neck and over the patient's head, and move it back and forth over the area until the bone is reduced to its original position. Whenever the bone is reduced with a reduction that descends, it should not be hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And in addition, the stick should not be harmful to the fractured bone; and therefore, you must examine the patient every day, as when the swelling is reduced or the stick is removed, then you correct it and tighten the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And place the patient's head on a pillow or bolster and sleep with their head slightly elevated, so that the support under their neck is also elevated, which raises the fracture of the neck to an elevation of the muscle; or it may be that their arms are placed on their neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the bandage unless pus or pressure sores occur in the area before twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And renew the plaster if you see any signs of infection in the area, and adjust it in the bandage and restore it until it is restored and the fracture of the neck is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it should be strengthened and comforted according to the usual period of twenty-eight days, and in some cases in men, it is done within the month's time of that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken at its middle part and not completely, but only at the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	Therefore when it is broken in its middle part, and not completely, but only at the edges, it is recognized by touch alone. Then according to the shape of the fracture, prepare for its reduction and align it in accordance with its natural position in any possible way that you can.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Place powdered poppy seeds mixed with white of egg and stopper lion; place double-fold cloth over it; place on the steel rod of thin table according to the size of the spatula or a little more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the rod is concave at one of the parts of the spatula, then you fill that concavity with stopper lion and adjust the rod accordingly.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Place strong and long human hair over it, with tight constriction and secure the rod inside so that it does not protrude from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	Consider the bandage every day; and every time it becomes soft, replace it with a new one and tighten and adjust the rod if it protrudes from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	Wash the patient over his own bed.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula will heal in 20 days or a little more.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	Therefore when this number is completed, you should remove the bandage and be sure that the bones from which it began have healed and their dissolution is not feared.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if there is pressure on the bone and you see swelling, then cut it open and remove it, and proceed as previously mentioned in the cervical fracture treatment or cauterize the abscess if an abscess occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of the fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot is sometimes broken in its middle part and it heals by itself; but the ends move which are swollen and crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	The signs that the middle part is broken are that it inclines towards the sides and a great pain occurs, difficulty in breathing, coughing, high fever and vomiting; and it is visible in the cavity of the broken bone and not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	The treatment of this is that the patient lies on his back, a cushion placed between his shoulder blades; and press the muscles of it, adjust the ribs of it with both hands and be careful during the operation and in the alignment according to any possible method that is appropriate and convenient, until the shape of the bone returns as it should.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Place a plaster and stopper on it, and place a thin steel rod of willow or walnut and its equivalent in weight, then wrap it; be careful not to damage the broken bone; move it slowly according to the curvature of the back for some time, and tighten it with proper constriction; consider the position at all times, and when it becomes soft, tighten it again.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary, you should cause its removal due to corrosion or prussic acid, pain, or abscess that occurs in the area; then cut and release it, remove the plaster and correct any problems caused by it with methods of healing it; and replace the plaster as needed; and adjust its tightness until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that the fracture of the ribs occurs in large parts and not near the spine; and at the ends of these divisions, it does not occur due to compression but because they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And the detection of this is not hidden from sensation, so you should investigate it with questions.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the treatment is to fill the fracture with questions according to any possible method until it is filled as necessary, and then apply a plaster and tighten the broken bone with a rod, if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs is declining towards the sides, then the patient experiences intense pain and puncture, like the pain that occurs in those who have pleurisy, and for this reason the lining of the lung should be applied; and there will be difficulty breathing, coughing, and vomiting with blood; and this is difficult to heal.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	The ancients were skilled in that area with many ingenious methods.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And they said: it is necessary to stop the food of the patient that produces inflammation and wind, so that his stomach may be inflated and extended, and the fracture should be pushed towards the sides outside.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we should avoid this as much as possible to prevent the formation of abscess, if not necessary; and if it occurs, help with it immediately.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	Some of them said it should be stopped above the bladder and that urine should be expelled; this is like reasoning, but it is feared that the bladder may attract impurities to the area due to its weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	Some of them said: it should be covered with wool that has been immersed in hot oil, and powder should be placed between the ribs until it is filled, and the position should be aligned when wrapping it according to its curvature; and the patient should be treated with pleurisy diet and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the patient is experiencing intense constriction which they cannot bear, and their bones press on a tender spot through puncture, fear for the patient arises. Therefore, it is necessary to make an incision at that location, expose the fractured rib, cover it with the instrument mentioned before (which preserves the opening), remember its recall, and cut the bone easily, then extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then we adjust the two lips of the wound (if it is large), sew them up with sutures, and care for it with plasters until it heals.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	If there is an abscess inside (a collection of pus), then you must make an incision and pour warm oil on the affected area, wait for it to heal, and take care of the patient with whatever is required for an internal abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	The person should lie down on their side on the affected side until they recover.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of the fracture of the spine and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some fractures occur in the bones of the neck and soon thereafter cause their adhesion, similar to fractures of the spine in the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And if you want to know whether a fracture will heal or not, consider that if the muscles around it are already softened and stiffened and dead and cannot be strengthened or extended, and when you press on them with your fingers or prick them with a needle and do not feel pain in them, then you know that it is not healing, and in this case, it is fatal within a month.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if the muscles are bad and feel constriction when pressed or pricked with a needle, then you know that the neck of the bone is saved, and the patient will recover with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	If you see a fracture of the spine in the neck and want to know if it will heal or not, consider the position of the legs (paralysis).
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	If you see that they are already softened (meaning the fracture has healed), then apply whatever is appropriate for such cases, and when they lie on their back, they vomit involuntarily and have a feeling of restlessness and sometimes lie on their chest and cannot urinate, then you know it is fatal, and do not bother with its treatment.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of these occur, the cause is better and easier to manage.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	The treatment for this is to perform the incision of the abscess with a warm cautery applied to the adhered spine, or with mullein leaves soaked in oil; apply it several times a day until the abscess is healed.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a comforting and healing plaster, strengthen it with lint, and command the patient to rest and be calm and not sleep on the affected side until it heals.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to adhere the bone to the cartilage or any cause that has been separated from it, then you must dry the affected area and remove the bone; then adjust the two lips of the wound (if it is large), sew them up with sutures; and cover it with a dressing made of ointment until it heals.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the joint of the bone at the ankle is broken and the end of the tendon is affected, then you must insert your left hand into the buttocks, grab the broken bone with the other hand as much as possible by equalizing it, and cover it with a plaster and splint if necessary, and strengthen it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	If you feel broken joints in it (the patient), then cut them open, remove the bone, and treat the wound with the treatment prescribed until it heals.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the inguinal hernia.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the inguinal area are usually broken, and if they break, their fracture is not a true fracture but rather a dislocation at the extremity that is pushed inwards and goes through the length and slope towards the affected side; and when the patient feels pain in that area and pressure or pricking with a needle, the hernia swells when it is broken.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	The restoration of this is to stretch your hand over it until it covers the fracture, which is the shape of the hernia.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	If the fracture is only at the end of it (the hernia), then you grab it as much as possible according to what is appropriate for equalizing it, until it resembles its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the length or slopes towards the affected side, then you have the patient lie on their stomach until the restoration of the fracture is prepared.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have grabbed it, apply a plaster to it, and cover it with a wooden or cloth splint, and strengthen it by tying it tightly, without fear of causing further fracture or removal of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	Grab the concavity with what fills it until it tightens evenly, and command the patient to sleep on their back or on their healthy side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if an abscess forms (a collection of pus), you stop the extension and restoration of it until the abscess is healed, and cover it with whatever is appropriate to heal it; then return to the restoration of the hernia, and strengthen it as necessary.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if this happens in the bones at the joints or they are fractured, you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Title. XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the Restoration of Adjuvant Bone Fractures.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjutor is that which is between the shoulder and the neck.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, the restoration of it is done in one of two ways, of which one is that you take a flat piece of lead of medium thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And attach them at both ends with straps, and place it in a raised location.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	Follow the patient over a seat, and throw his broken arm into the hole up to the handle, which is in the middle of where the curve of the pole is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And suspend it for some serious reason, or the minister extends it to the outside; and have the doctor and his assistants near where the fracture is, until the fracture returns as needed.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other method is that the patient lies on his back and suspends his arm from his neck with a strap, and commands two assistants to one of them to hold what is above the fracture with their hands; and the other to hold the pillow below him; and each one extends to their side.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, you must pull on the fracture with a strap and on the other side with another strap, and each of the two assistants extends to their sides.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And therefore if the fracture is close to the muscle's edge, it is necessary that half of the strap be placed on the handle and the other half on the side of the fracture.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	Similarly, if the fracture is near the joint, it is necessary that the strap be placed at that location and on that joint.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Tie it with ease and without effort, and apply it as necessary and in good alignment, then pull on it if an abscess does not develop.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an abscess forms, leave the tightening for seven days and apply wool soaked in warm vinegar and rose oil over it until the abscess subsides, then pull on it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the method of strengthening it is to apply plaster on the fracture, and place a cover of thick cloth over the plaster; and adjust the arm on that support, and place his hand open on the muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And hold the cloth and pull on the support for the arm to be in a stable position, unless there is any reason that prevents it due to the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And you use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And you place a wider and stronger splint on the fracture than the others; and between each splint leave the width of a finger, and the length of the splints should be according to the fracture with an addition of three digits in total.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And pull on the splints with the tightening mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And your tightening on the site of the fracture should be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as the fracture becomes longer, the tightening should become smaller.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore if the situation of the splints and the tightening is as described at the time when you restore the limb to its position, then do it.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an abscess, leave the tightening and splints for seven days as described.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And consider the strap in all parts for three days so that there is no immediate or inflammation at the site, or food is prohibited from reaching the limb due to excessive tightening of the strap; and therefore correct everything as described.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are certain that there will be no problem with this, do not remove the ligature until at least three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	The patient's sleep should be on his back, and his hands on his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place a hot cooked splint full of woolen bandage on the injured limb, and consider at all times of the night or day that the shape of the broken limb should not be loosened or dissolved, or that the straps are softened; therefore correct everything with your judgment.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	The patient's food should be according to the order that was previously mentioned, in such a way that the food is subtle at first until it becomes stronger; and therefore you must make it coarse.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	In custom of the assistant and bedside, they are strengthened for forty days; and then it is necessary that they be discontinued and a bath given, and medicine administered with oil, which corrects [the condition].
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is open, then you do not remove the ligament and splint immediately, but leave it for days or up to two months.
Capitol .xii.	12th Chapter
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of the fracture of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called the two focils; one is small, and it is the one that is referred to as the little head, and the other is large and is the one that is placed below the small one, from the lower part of the arm.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And when only the large bone (focal major) is broken or both are fractured together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small bone (focal minor) is broken above, the restoration of it is easy, and its healing is more easy.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the bone below (the larger one) is broken, the fracture of it is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And even worse if both bones are fractured together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the small one above, it is appropriate for the doctor to make a small extension with ease before the wound is sewn up.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the large bone is fractured, a more forceful extension is necessary.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both bones are fractured together, you must make the extraction less forcefully.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	You must make the figure of the hand with the restoration and extension stretched out on a cushion, and place the fingers at the edges above, as all others have said, and the ear (auricular) should be lower than the others, and the patient should lie down centred over a low couch.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion in front of him at his height or inclined to him, so that the patient does not suffer labor.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And bring the minister (assistant) to stretch out the arm from above to below with his hand or a ligament, and another minister should do the same above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And bring the doctor to sew up the bone inside so that he reduces it according to the best shape possible.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if there is a fissure in the bone, you must carefully reduce all things in their place with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if a fissure appears separated that pierces the skin and is not hopeful for restoration of it, then you make an incision over it and remove it according to the manner we have described above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with an ulcer, then refer to the special chapter we have already discussed, and thus take care of it.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess arises at the beginning of your restoration, then you should line a cloth with a suture made of rose oil and white wax, which is moderate in thickness and strength, and stretch the cloth over it with a subtle string until the abscess is softened; then remove the suture and apply an emplaster prepared from milled powder with clay of huou, and place splints; and let the splint that is placed over the fracture be firm and strong.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you should know that the number of splints for the arm is seven in the major positions, or if the fracture is in one bone or two bones together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And place your string over the location of the fracture firmly and forcefully, and when the extraction is to the edges above or below the fracture, place the string a little less tight according to the reminder given at the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft and moist, not hard or harsh, and the thread with which it is strengthened should be of moderate thickness, as we have recommended above.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	Consider the limb (arm) and the ligament for several days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause arises for which correction is necessary, such as a swelling on the limb, then you must bind the limb with warm water until it ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	Unbind the limb and let it rest until it is healed, and then replace the string.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the extraction has been softened and the bone has healed and appears similar to others, then correct everything with your skill.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	Consider more if the nourishment is prevented from reaching the limb due to excess binding, for then it is necessary to soften it slightly and leave it for several days until the nourishment reaches it, and strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if there is no such cause for the patient as we have mentioned, then it is not necessary to remove it before about twenty days or more after that.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And let the hand of the patient be suspended by its ability to move agitatedly, and place it to sleep on its own back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	You know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or 40 days, or it heals quickly in 28 days, and all of this depends on the complexity of the case and the properties of the individual.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the healing of a finger fracture and thumb fracture.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	You know that a finger fracture or thumb sprain can lead to a fracture, but it does not occur unless excessive movement is observed.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	When the finger or thumb is fractured or sprained, it is necessary that the patient remains immobilized and elevated at an angle equal to the elbow, and place a pad under the affected area.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	Then the assistant should extend the fractured bones, and the doctor will align them properly using good alignment.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	It is necessary to apply a plaster and padding, unless an abscess occurs; place a steel splint as needed over the affected area, and you have already wrapped it in linen cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	However, if the fracture is in the palm area, you should place a bandage around it and instruct the patient to grasp the broken part with their other hand. The bandage should be tightened with a long strip of cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	The splint should be made of wood or some other material that allows for elevation, so that the palm is in contact with it and the splint should be tightened as necessary.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is in the fingers outside of the palm, you should place a splint above and another below the finger on the palm side to open and straighten the hand. Then apply a tight bandage as needed, like wrapping the hand around the wrist using linen strips.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	If a toe or knuckle of the finger is fractured, if possible, immerse it in warm water and align it as necessary and tighten with a small straight splint to raise the fracture and prevent it from worsening.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	If the fracture is in the other fingers, such as in the middle finger or index finger or thumb or ring finger, immerse it in warm water and align it with the affected digit or all of them together if possible, which is better; or place a small splint over it as mentioned earlier for the toe.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	Consider in your treatment the disposal of an abscess and its prevention with proper operations, as well as what should be done when any cause of this occurs, according to the narrative provided.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the healing of a hip bone fracture.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	A fractured hip bone is recognized by the feeling in the affected area and swelling above and below the groin.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	The healing process involves wrapping a bandage around the fracture and another below it, and the patient lies on their back with their legs raised.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	The assistant should extend the bandage over the entire affected area when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	If the dislocation of the hip joint is suspected, apply a bandage to the lower area around the pubic bone, so that the extension covers above, and another bandage below the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the fracture is suspected to be in the lower area, apply a bandage near the pubic bone and let the extension reach the areas below.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	The doctor should align the bone with both hands inside and reduce it as naturally as possible so that the bone is properly aligned and joined well by good joining; then apply a plaster and bandage, unless an abscess occurs in the affected limb.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	If an abscess occurs, leave it for several days until the abscess has been treated, and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The bandage should be applied like this: wrap a firm bandage around the fracture, fold it over two or three times, and remove any excess; then wrap a cloth around the affected limb up to the ankle and hip joint.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	Insert a long probe between the thigh and hip close to the pelvis at the dividing point, and let the ends of the probe extend from the lower division more than from both parts, then roll it back and forth over the thigh and hip so that the excess of the bandage is removed.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	Then pause on the thigh at the location of that fracture, and place one steel rod on the bone of the hip.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	Then fill the empty spaces between thigh and pelvis with much cloth, to coagulate the extrusion.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	Begin with a strong bandage around the middle at the location of the fracture with three or four wrappings, and as you get further from the location of the fracture, your bandage should be lighter and less wet.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	Extend the ends of the probe to the dividing points on both sides of the foot until it reaches the heel of the foot, and strengthen the ends of the rods from the other side so that the bandage does not slip out of its place.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	Lay the bandage on that which does not cause corrosion of the member, nor cauterization abscess or swelling and resemble those; and if any such occurrence arises, then immediately remove it, and correct whatever occurred in an appropriate manner, as I have said many times before.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is pain in the bone that you have set, then it is necessary for you to immobilize it as much as possible; and if you cannot do so, fumigate it and remove it, and heal it with what follows the memory of the cure until it heals.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	This fracture of the thigh is strengthened more than those that are set with rods, as I have said in the assistant and arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	But in the treatment of this fracture in such a manner does not cause the patient's limping; and if it is treated alone, another thigh must be applied to it, then it is necessary for the one affected to always limp.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	Know that the thigh is strengthened in 40 days or a few months or a few weeks, and all of this depends on the diversity of complications and other circumstances.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	On the treatment of the fracture of the heel bone.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Know that the fracture of the heel bone heals more slowly than in many observed cases.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	But if there is a fracture, then it is only a fissure or crack in its divisions, and that is with one or two plagues, and all of this is with the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	The treatment of it is such that what is broken in its divisions should be immobilized until it is united and consolidated as much as possible by means of easy, simple, and convenient materials.
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	Then apply plaster and place a round rod on it if necessary; and strengthen above with bandage as appropriate.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	And consider all the dispositions that we have recommended in other fractures, such as cauterization abscess and similar to these as long as they oppose any accident that is appropriate for it until it heals.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	On the treatment of a hip fracture.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the hip there are two bones of which one is large and is called the pelvis; and the other is thin, and is called the acetabulum.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And if there are any of the species of fracture that occur in the two bones of the arm, and its treatment is done as in the treatment of the arm by immobilization, and the operation is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if the bones are crushed together, the pelvis is converted into all divisions.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the thin bone is crushed, the pelvis is converted to the anterior divisions.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the large bone is crushed, move it backwards, and it is due to those causes that you are not familiar with.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And apply extension, alignment, and ligature of the rods according to the immobilization.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	But if the pelvis fracture is shallow and has many cavities, then the extension should be less and lighter, and alleviate it with your skill.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	In the pelvis is any cause for operation on the arm, and it occurs when you immobilize the rods and complete all the necessary procedures, then you will take pieces of pine wood that are placed under the causes that are already cushioned with soles, and they are made in exactly the same way as branches of palm; alleviate those with a small amount of coarseness, and it should not be too thick, and the length of these should correspond to the length of the pelvis from the hip to the heel.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	Then cover each one with two layers of cloth according to its length, and place one on the dividing line of the pelvis of one side and the other on the other side, and they should be from the hip to the heel of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And place the two rods in three locations of both ends and in the middle location, because with this bandage the pelvis is prevented from clinking on the left and right sides, and it is a good position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And apply a splint of wood according to the length of the pelvis; it should be placed on the pelvis to prevent movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And moreover, you must do this for a fracture, and when it is indeed an open wound.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And daily observe the wound and study it further, and keep it from abscess and inflammation or other similar causes; and when any of those occur, then apply what is necessary until it heals.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the heel bone and the bones of the foot, and on the toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	Not every part of the heel bone suffers a fracture; instead, certain bones in the foot may experience fractures; and the toes of the foot rarely experience fractures, except for strains during the months of discomfort.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot undergo a fracture and the bone fragments are elevated above their original position, then the patient should place his/her foot on a prepared surface such as when walking.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	The patient should place one foot on the elevated bone and apply pressure, push, and hold it in place until it returns to its original position.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	The patient should place a plaster and a pad on top of it, and under the foot, place a small table with two hollow spaces.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And bind that part of the foot in a downward position with bandages, as you have already wrapped it using various methods.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And after three or four days, you should remove the bandages because you will observe the bones that are held in place, either broken or dislocated, and the operation in such cases is as follows.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if the toes are broken, then you should set them, and hold them in place as I have previously recommended for the restoration of the hand's fingers.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And place the broken toe in the position it was before, slightly wider than its original width; and under the foot, place the table that I have recommended to you, and bind it with appropriate bandages.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if the fracture involves more than two or three bones, then you should place a splint on each toe of its appropriate size wrapped in linen cloth, and secure the table under the heel of the foot, with it standing on one of the table's legs to keep it stable.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And be careful to remember that you should not overlook all the causes mentioned in previous discussions on fractures of the various accidents that have been described; and always apply remedies for any such occurrence.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the coccyx in women, the pelvis bone, and the sacrum in men.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the coccyx of a woman is broken, you should cause it to heal in a fallen position, and incline it slightly towards the posterior part, and hold it behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	The midwife should pack the coccyx with cotton, and apply it in the same way as usual; and the woman should be shaken, and gradually raise her hips slightly, for everything will heal behind the coccyx until it is in front of the split bone, and the broken bone returns to its original position.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	Place poultices on the hips and when she wants to urinate, remove the cotton with ease and allow her to urinate; then return it in the same way as you initially applied it, and then return the poultice to its original position.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	Do this for seven days or until it heals, as it is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if desired, take an oval bladder and bind it over the bone with a reed tube; insert the entire bladder into the coccyx, and inflate the tube with air until the bladder is inflated inside the coccyx, for the fracture will return.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And fill it with cotton and keep it as I have recommended until it heals.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	When the pelvic bone in a man or woman is broken, administer the remedy and treatment for healing and reduction that I have recommended for the hip bone.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And do not hide these remedies in the treatment of such fractures, as they are few and far between, especially for those who have studied medicine, are familiar with my book, and understand its meaning; for this fracture indicates to you that the correct path towards healing and binding lies in its restoration and stricture, and therefore beware.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the case of male sacrum fracture, take guarguamela root, place it on the sacrum; and then bind it with linen cloth, and bandage it for three days or until it heals.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of a fracture when it is open.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is necessary for those who experience a fracture with an open wound, especially if the bone is large like the femur or humerus, or similar, to cauterize and probe it as soon as possible under conditions of cauterization that you or your witnesses have described previously.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the wound exudes blood, you should take measures to stop its flow until you apply powdered zeja triturate or use another means if necessary.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	Then begins the restoration of the fracture on that day, and do not prolong it if there is no abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	If there is an abscess, leave the restoration of it for up to ten days, until the abscess subsides, and do not approach it on the third and fourth day altogether, because you will cause bad consequences.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	If the broken bone protrudes above the skin opening, it is necessary that you force yourself to reduce and bind it with your hands as easily and with as little extension as possible.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If the extension is not well prepared and the position of it with your hands, you reduce it with these tools; and this tool is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight fingers or according to the size of the wound; and it is necessary for the doctor to take one of these three or four depending on the quantity that is needed for the treatment in all types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round, and not too thick so that it is not bent during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	It should have a sharp tip at the end and be thick on top, and of moderate size between the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is its shape:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	It is named in Greek "labre voluntas atelarem", which means a small palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because it is necessary to be placed the tip of it raised above the end of the bone that protrudes.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	Press it into a position and bind it with some kind of fixation.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	Therefore, bind the fracture ends together, and if the broken end is thin, do not use the tool for good reason, but you must insert the tip of the bone into it until the instrument has enough power over it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you cannot reduce the bone completely with this tool, then insert it as far as the chisels we mentioned; or it will be with one of the saws in whatever way is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	Remove that which remains in the bone, rough and full of small notches.
